commit_message:
New objects for NUMA live migration

This patch contains the Nova object modifications that will eventually
enable NUMA live migration:

* (src|dst)_supports_numa_live_migration are added to
LibvirtLiveMigrateData. They will be used by the source and
destination hosts to signal to each other that they can perform a
NUMA-aware live migration.

* LibvirtLiveMigrateNUMAInfo is a new object that encodes how the
instance's NUMA-y things will fit on the destination host. It contains
things like the new CPU pins, the new NUMA cell pins, and the new
emulator thread pins.

* dst_numa_info is added to LibvirtLiveMigrateData. It contains a
LibvirtLiveMigrateNUMAInfo object. It will be set by the destination
and will be used by the source to update the instance's XML.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: I7c7f54ab142f01808ee4b46d27b4a336e476cc77

Agent - Conntrack Helper

Implements the L3 agent conntrack helper extension.

Closes: #1823633

Change-Id: I7dd54e11288a0ad2569abfc351258e97b5f5803c
Implements: blueprint placement-req-filter-forbidden-aggregates
"}]
commit_message:
DB API changes to get non-matching aggregates from metadata

Added a new DB API to return list of aggregates that don't match
metadata keys that start with key_prefix with the list of required
traits set on the flavor and image.

Change-Id: I7dd54e11288a0ad2569abfc351258e97b5f5803c
Implements: blueprint placement-req-filter-forbidden-aggregates

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: I8ebbe9ea1bb2914061a8307f3edfabab166a3c38

commit_message:
healthcheck: List udp ports with ss

Looks like octavia healthmanager uses UDP 5555 port.

Also changes octavia-health-manager healath check to use
healthcheck_port rather than healthcheck_listen, as udp
is a connectionless protocol.

Change-Id: Id48d5efe17eeb1a524e280d8885e98cfe1a5577a
Related-Bug: #1843555

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 16036, 'name': 'Krzysztof Klimonda', 'email': 'kklimonda@syntaxhighlighted.com', 'username': 'kklimonda'}, {'_account_id': 19316, 'name': 'Eduardo Gonzalez', 'email': 'dabarren@gmail.com', 'username': 'egonzalez90'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 29543, 'name': 'Scott Solkhon', 'email': 'scott.solkhon@gresearch.co.uk', 'username': 'scott.solkhon'}, {'_account_id': 30356, 'name': 'gugug', 'email': 'gu.jin@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gujin'}, {'_account_id': 30500, 'name': 'zhangyi', 'email': 'zhangyi@awcloud.com'}, {'_account_id': 30517, 'name': 'As If', 'email': 'ascammon@hotmail.com', 'username': 'stackedsax'}, {'_account_id': 30810, 'name': 'James Kirsch', 'email': 'generalfuzz@gmail.com', 'username': 'generalfuzz'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16036, 'date': '2019-06-06 09:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16036, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:34:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16036, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16036, 'date': '2019-06-06 12:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16036, 'date': '2019-06-06 13:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-06 15:26:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

Just had a skim, but looks like a good start. I'd probably suggest picking it apart into a few separate patches to make it easier on reviewers. In particular, pulling the insecure flag out could be done separately, and would remove a lot of noise. We could also separate the internal TLS frontend from TLS backends."}, {'account_id': 16036, 'date': '2019-06-07 06:52:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

Good idea, we can split it like that:

1. Review for the implementation of the "frontend" TLS for internal and admin networks, in particular:
    - Adding support for distinct internal and external certificates
    - Adding support for merging public and internal/admin endpoints
    - Making sure that all frontend changes are not affecting upgrades
2. Adding backend TLS encryption
3. Adding support for deployment with insecure certificates and CI jobs for TLS scenarios'}, {'account_id': 16036, 'date': '2019-06-07 09:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from cloudferro/keystone-tls to bp/add-ssl-internal-network'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-07 09:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-07 09:46:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > Good idea, we can split it like that:
 > 
 > 1. Review for the implementation of the "frontend" TLS for internal
 > and admin networks, in particular:
 > - Adding support for distinct internal and external certificates
 > - Adding support for merging public and internal/admin endpoints

This one is already kind of the default (no separate external network) - we just need to ensure it continues to work when internal network is encrypted.

 > - Making sure that all frontend changes are not affecting upgrades
 > 2. Adding backend TLS encryption
 > 3. Adding support for deployment with insecure certificates and CI
 > jobs for TLS scenarios

CI job could be separate, but otherwise, looks good.'}, {'account_id': 16036, 'date': '2019-06-11 07:42:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16036, 'date': '2019-06-11 16:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/add-ssl-internal-network-split to bp/add-ssl-internal-network'}, {'account_id': 30500, 'date': '2019-06-12 09:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30356, 'date': '2019-06-13 07:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-21 09:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thanks, this looks like a good start.

There is a check in ansible/roles/prechecks/tasks/service_checks.yml which will fail if internal == external and TLS is enabled.

Horizon port on internal network should be 443 if using TLS: ansible/roles/horizon/defaults/main.yml, and we should have a similar redirect from port 80 as used in external.

Also need a precheck for the certificate in ansible/roles/haproxy/tasks/precheck.yml.

Most of these came from grepping for tls.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-08-15 21:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-08-15 22:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-08-16 08:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for updating James. Just reposting some comments from my last review, in case they got lost.

There is a check in ansible/roles/prechecks/tasks/service_checks.yml which will fail if internal == external and TLS is enabled.

Horizon port on internal network should be 443 if using TLS: ansible/roles/horizon/defaults/main.yml, and we should have a similar redirect from port 80 as used in external.

Also need a precheck for the certificate in ansible/roles/haproxy/tasks/precheck.yml.

Most of these came from grepping for tls.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-08-16 18:13:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-08-16 22:02:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-08-19 12:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

[{'created': '2019-06-06 09:16:23.000000000', 'message': 'Implement internal endpoint and backend TLS - Approach #2

This review proposes an alternate internal TLS implementation, with
backends taking part in the encryption. This differs from
I01cac037d027d3fc542c0046494dccd24f79affc where HAProxy was always
terminating TLS traffic and forwarding it to the local backend
unencrypted, or to a remote HAProxy.

The initial patchset implements internal TLS endpoints and backend
encryption for Keystone only, and adds some logic that lets change
backend encryption on a service-by-service basis. This can be removed
once all supported services are handled in one form or another.

commit_message:
Implement TLS encryption for internal endpoints

This review is the first one in a series of patches and it introduces an
optional encryption for internal openstack endpoints, implementing part
of the add-ssl-internal-network spec.

Change-Id: I6589751626486279bf24725f22e71da8cd7f0a43

commit_message:
Default to connecting clients via ip rather than local socket

This patch changes the connection type to always be an ip address.
Previously a non-clustered galera would connect to 'localhost' which
is the local socket, not an ip connection.

This change allows the default value "galera_address" to always apply,
for clustered or non-clustered setups.

Change-Id: Ic01cebc4cb790f72a96b960de4ad9626a4058f08

commit_message:
Reenable nodepool testing for opensuse images

This was disabled in I6dcfeaf97b3b4865039d3dffdcc1e13b4120be77 however
the issue has been fixed (as seen by voting gates in glean and
nodepool). The referenced ticket https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001995
seems to be marked as fixed.

Change-Id: I9f0e0084e280c905148c9c4befa089adf4e77001

commit_message:
Stop sending execution object via Zaqar message

Execution object can be quite large which is not suitable
for sending via Zaqar messages. Instead we're sending
execution_id and root_execution_id which can be used by the client
to retrieve execution details

Depends-On: Ia6c954e688589f69a7463f1b8e02244d029e8b7a
Change-Id: I010ea5d732aba97a554e868f62a19e6fdaee8889
(cherry picked from commit 37fc8e31717e60bf6f2e125384b095fc514ac038)

commit_message:
Fix nova-conductor healthcheck RPC port

It currently assumes the default RPCPort.

Execution object can be quite large which is not suitable
for sending via Zaqar messages. Instead we're sending

commit_message:
Stop sending execution object via Zaqar message

Execution object can be quite large which is not suitable
for sending via Zaqar messages. Instead we're sending
execution_id and root_execution_id which can be used by the client
to retrieve execution details

Depends-On: Ia6c954e688589f69a7463f1b8e02244d029e8b7a
Change-Id: I010ea5d732aba97a554e868f62a19e6fdaee8889
(cherry picked from commit 37fc8e31717e60bf6f2e125384b095fc514ac038)

commit_message:
base/deb: bump 'system' users limit beyond Kolla ones

Haproxy complains that user 'haproxy' already exists during installation
and is not 'system user'. So let bump range for 'system' users to make
it happier.

Our images do not have normal users so it should not affect.

Change-Id: Ia073774c8053111652847a39d80665fd9d3e5dcf

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-13 07:38:46.000000000', 'message': "Remove unneeded Zuul branch matcher

We have implicit branch matchers, so there's no need to add a check
for not-ocata etc, a job is only run for the branch it's on - like
master now.

Remove it to not confuse Zuul when multiple branches matches and the job
definition is different.

Change-Id: I6a346c9141aad1aa8a7393c899d5571057073e7a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unneeded Zuul branch matcher

We have implicit branch matchers, so there's no need to add a check
for not-ocata etc, a job is only run for the branch it's on - like
master now.

Remove it to not confuse Zuul when multiple branches matches and the job
definition is different.

Change-Id: I6a346c9141aad1aa8a7393c899d5571057073e7a

[{'created': '2019-08-27 13:16:10.000000000', 'message': "Do not query allocations twice in finish_revert_resize

This patch resolves a TODO in finish_revert_resize about querying the
instance's original allocation twice from placement.

The _revert_allocation() helper returned True if the instance had a
migration allocation that is reverted. But non of the callers of this
helper used the return value. So this patch changes the signature so
the helper now returns the original allocation which is the instance
allocation _after_ the the revert succeeded. This way the provider
mapping calculation can reuse the allocation information.

Change-Id: I8dc8f043acb426149e8f3f8436fae65adf11b099

commit_message:
Do not query allocations twice in finish_revert_resize

This patch resolves a TODO in finish_revert_resize about querying the
instance's original allocation twice from placement.

The _revert_allocation() helper returned True if the instance had a
migration allocation that is reverted. But none of the callers of this
helper used the return value. So this patch changes the signature so
the helper now returns the original allocation which is the instance
allocation _after_ the the revert succeeded. This way the provider
mapping calculation can reuse the allocation information.

Change-Id: I8dc8f043acb426149e8f3f8436fae65adf11b099
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-01 13:00:19.000000000', 'message': 'DRAC : clear_job_queue clean step to fix pending bios config jobs

If pending bios config job for changing the boot mode
is in job queue on an overcloud node, then ironic will
abandon the introspection attempt for the node,
which will cause overall introspection to fail.
Added clear_job_queue cleaning step in the iDRAC driver that
clears the Lifecycle Controller job queue even if there is
pending bios config job in job queue.

Change-Id: I35e4c61dd44384429224dee6de9827d8debe9cf9
Story: 2006322
Task: 36053

commit_message:
DRAC : clear_job_queue clean step to fix pending bios config jobs

If pending bios config job for changing the boot mode
is in job queue on an overcloud node, then ironic will
abandon the introspection attempt for the node,
which will cause overall introspection to fail.

Added clear_job_queue cleaning step in the iDRAC driver that
clears the Lifecycle Controller job queue even if there is
pending bios config job or any other pending job in job queue.

Change-Id: I35e4c61dd44384429224dee6de9827d8debe9cf9
Story: 2006322
Task: 36053

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 16:07:07.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: WIP: PDF documentation build

- sphinxcontrib-svg2pdfconverter is used to handle SVG properly.
- maxlistdepth=10 in latex_elements is needed to handle
  deeper levels of nesting.
- bindep.txt is borrowed from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601659/

sample-config is temporarily excluded from the hidden toctree
in doc/source/configuration/index.rst and :orphan: is used.
If it is included in the hidden toctree, LaTeX fails with
"TeX capacity exceeded: sorry [main memory size=5000000]"
(with PDF output) .... and if excluded LaTeX fails.
The outputs from both cases looks same.

Change-Id: I3aaea1d15a357f550f529beaa84fb1a1a7748358
'}, {'created': '2019-08-15 16:13:34.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: WIP: PDF documentation build

- maxlistdepth=10 in latex_elements is needed to handle
  deeper levels of nesting.

sample-config is temporarily excluded from the hidden toctree
in doc/source/configuration/index.rst and :orphan: is used.
If it is included in the hidden toctree, LaTeX fails with
"TeX capacity exceeded: sorry [main memory size=5000000]"
(with PDF output) .... and if excluded LaTeX fails.
The outputs from both cases looks same.

'}, {'created': '2019-08-19 17:29:46.000000000', 'message': 'PDF documentation build

- sphinxcontrib-svg2pdfconverter is used to handle SVG properly.
- maxlistdepth=10 in latex_elements is needed to handle
  deeper levels of nesting.
- bindep.txt is borrowed from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601659/
- Sample config/policy files are skipped in the PDF document
  as inline sample files cause LaTeX error and direct links
  in PDF doc is discouraged.

sample-config is temporarily excluded from the hidden toctree
in doc/source/configuration/index.rst and :orphan: is used.
If it is included in the hidden toctree, LaTeX fails with
"TeX capacity exceeded: sorry [main memory size=5000000]"
(with PDF output) .... and if excluded LaTeX fails.
The outputs from both cases looks same.

  in PDF doc is discouraged.
- create new pdf-docs environment that is used during openstack-tox-docs
  run.

sample-config is temporarily excluded from the hidden toctree
in doc/source/configuration/index.rst and :orphan: is used.
If it is included in the hidden toctree, LaTeX fails with
"TeX capacity exceeded: sorry [main memory size=5000000]"
(with PDF output) .... and if excluded LaTeX fails.
The outputs from both cases looks same.

commit_message:
PDF documentation build

- Add a new pdf-docs environment to enable PDF build.
- sphinxcontrib-svg2pdfconverter is used to handle SVG properly.
- maxlistdepth=10 in latex_elements is needed to handle
  deeper levels of nesting.
- Sample config/policy files are skipped in the PDF document
  as inline sample files cause LaTeX error [1] and direct links
  in PDF doc is discouraged. Note that sample-config and sample-policy
  need to be excluded to avoid the LaTeX error [1] and
  :orphan: is specified in those files.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/3099

Change-Id: I3aaea1d15a357f550f529beaa84fb1a1a7748358

commit_message:
Add immutable roles status check

This implements part 3 of the proposed change for immutable roles[1], as
well as adds a release note.

Part 4 (changing the default behavior of ``keystone-manage bootstrap``
will have to come in the next cycle.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/train/immutable-resources.html#proposed-change

Change-Id: Ie9d658deb1fa69e9007f3c50535b5c48a7a292d1
Partial-bug: #1823258

commit_message:
Implement system admin for OAUTH1 consumers

This change deprecates the rule:admin_required policies for the
create/update/delete actions of the OAUTH consumer API and replaces it
with the system-specific check strings for the admin role.

Change-Id: Id6742ff295ce206d0a4965465b0e9ec2ceab7cd5
Closes-bug: #1805363

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-12 08:03:37.000000000', 'message': 'Create _mech_context before delete to avoid race

When a network is deleted, precommit handlers are notified prior to the
deletion of the network from the database. One handler exists in the ML2
plugin - _network_delete_precommit_handler. This handler queries the
database for the current state of the network and uses it to create a
NetworkContext which it saves under context._mech_context. When the
postcommit handler _network_delete_after_delete_handler is triggered
later, it passess the saved context._mech_context to mechanism drivers.

A problem can occur with provider networks since the segments service
also registers a precommit handler - _delete_segments_for_network. Both
precommit handlers use the default priority, so the order in which they
are called is random, and determined by dict ordering. If the segment
precommit handler executes first, it will delete the segments associated
with the network. When the ML2 plugin precommit handler runs it then
sees no segments for the network and sets the provider attributes of the
network in the NetworkContext to None.

A mechanism driver that is passed a NetworkContext without provider
attributes in its delete_network_postcommit method will not have the
information to perform the necessary actions.  In the case of the
networking-generic-switch mechanism driver where this was observed, this
resulted in the driver ignoring the event, because the network did not
look like a VLAN.

This change uses a priority of zero for ML2 network delete precommit
handler, to ensure they query the network and store the NetworkContext
before the segments service has a chance to delete segments.

A similar change has been made for subnets, both to keep the pattern
consistent and avoid any similar issues.

Change-Id: I6482223ed2a479de4f5ef4cef056c311c0281408
Closes-Bug: #1841967
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/680001
(cherry picked from commit fea2d9091f71a2ec88318121ed9a22180e1ae96f)
'}]
commit_message:
Create _mech_context before delete to avoid race

When a network is deleted, precommit handlers are notified prior to the
deletion of the network from the database. One handler exists in the ML2
plugin - _network_delete_precommit_handler. This handler queries the
database for the current state of the network and uses it to create a
NetworkContext which it saves under context._mech_context. When the
postcommit handler _network_delete_after_delete_handler is triggered
later, it passess the saved context._mech_context to mechanism drivers.

A problem can occur with provider networks since the segments service
also registers a precommit handler - _delete_segments_for_network. Both
precommit handlers use the default priority, so the order in which they
are called is random, and determined by dict ordering. If the segment
precommit handler executes first, it will delete the segments associated
with the network. When the ML2 plugin precommit handler runs it then
sees no segments for the network and sets the provider attributes of the
network in the NetworkContext to None.

A mechanism driver that is passed a NetworkContext without provider
attributes in its delete_network_postcommit method will not have the
information to perform the necessary actions.  In the case of the
networking-generic-switch mechanism driver where this was observed, this
resulted in the driver ignoring the event, because the network did not
look like a VLAN.

This change uses a priority of zero for ML2 network delete precommit
handler, to ensure they query the network and store the NetworkContext
before the segments service has a chance to delete segments.

A similar change has been made for subnets, both to keep the pattern
consistent and avoid any similar issues.

Change-Id: I6482223ed2a479de4f5ef4cef056c311c0281408
Closes-Bug: #1841967
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/680001
(cherry picked from commit fea2d9091f71a2ec88318121ed9a22180e1ae96f)

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and magnum use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json module to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=jsonutils&type=

Change-Id: I06910797c44c2b1bd2297d4398da9ab984a8f770

[{'created': '2019-08-27 16:53:35.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Update DHCP port information during setup

When setting up the DHCP agent of a network, the DHCP namespace external
port is configured. If this port already exists and the fixed IP
addresses are correctly configured (in the DHCP subnets range), the port
is used as is.

Sometimes, because of 1627480 or 1841636, the port information is not
correctly retrieved. This patch does not solve it but mitigates the
process of resynchronizing the network DHCP. If the stored DHCP port
does not have the correct information, the agent calls the RPC plugin to
retrieve from the server the DHCP port updated information, including
the fixed IP address and the subnets.

commit_message:
Update DHCP port information during setup

When setting up the DHCP agent of a network, the DHCP namespace external
port is configured. If this port already exists and the fixed IP
addresses are correctly configured (in the DHCP subnets range), the port
is used as is.

Sometimes, because of 1627480 or 1841636, the port information is not
correctly retrieved. This patch does not solve it but mitigates the
process of resynchronizing the network DHCP. If the stored DHCP port
does not have the correct information, the agent calls the RPC plugin to
retrieve from the server the DHCP port updated information, including
the fixed IP address and the subnets.

Change-Id: Iff40e7bba645ee12c2001d7ce735a36e0ddc81e9
Related-Bug: #1627480
Related-Bug: #1841636

commit_message:
Remove immutable attributes before cleanup

File attributes such as +i or +a prevent the DIB from cleaning up
the built image, resulting in a build failure.

Example output: http://paste.openstack.org/raw/753793/

Change-Id: I743c1da5244439ca3d8321a7d0efb3457f1b6a10

commit_message:
UEFI iPXE provisioning fails when ipxe_use_swift is enabled

This patch adds missing '--name' argument to ramdisk command of ipxe.
Task: 30044
Story: 2005250

Change-Id: If307e9a55f001a98a4415cf707d87a21622ac588

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I1f280a05e3d329abf07c9d50ae28aee602691369

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-12 16:24:43.000000000', 'message': 'Enable deep_compare by default for stonith resource

With this commit we enable deep_compare by default, allowing stonith

commit_message:
Enable deep_compare by default for stonith resources

With this commit we enable deep_compare by default, allowing stonith
resources to be updated via stack update.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681778/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679407/
Change-Id: I330698f41cc092bdeb741c0b9c729264cf2cb28c

commit_message:
Abort waiting early if reached a failure state

Currently on failure we loop until timeout. This change will allow a run
to fail faster in such case also exposing the error message.

Change-Id: Ibf17d6c02bf835b86167b703ff1fb67fe932477b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-13 18:21:31.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: stub logging of host capabilities

By default we capture the logging output stream at INFO level
for unit/functional tests and anything that hits the libvirt
Host.get_capabilities method logs the giant xml host capabilities
string that is defined in the fakelibvirt module. This can cause
subunit parsing to fail because there is too much output in the
buffer.

This change simply stubs out that particular logging call in the
FakeLibvirtFixture class which is used extensively in the more
detailed libvirt tests like LibvirtConnTestCase. If this turns out
to not be good enough we can try stubbing at a more global level
like in the base nova TestCase.

Change-Id: I38b350bce908005161ed7c3eb737f32076828a37
Related-Bug: #1813147
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: stub logging of host capabilities

By default we capture the logging output stream at INFO level
for unit/functional tests and anything that hits the libvirt
Host.get_capabilities method logs the giant xml host capabilities
string that is defined in the fakelibvirt module. This can cause
subunit parsing to fail because there is too much output in the
buffer.

This change simply stubs out that particular logging call in the
FakeLibvirtFixture class which is used extensively in the more
detailed libvirt tests like LibvirtConnTestCase. If this turns out
to not be good enough we can try stubbing at a more global level
like in the base nova TestCase.

Change-Id: I38b350bce908005161ed7c3eb737f32076828a37
Related-Bug: #1813147

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-08 02:28:35.000000000', 'message': 'Implement system scope for domain role management

The roles API was partially converted to use default roles and system
scope but that work did not include converting the domain roles actions.
This commit completes the rest of the work and closes out the system
scope work for the roles API.

commit_message:
Implement system scope for domain role management

The roles API was partially converted to use default roles and system
scope but that work did not include converting the domain roles actions.
This commit completes the rest of the work and closes out the system
scope work for the roles API.

Change-Id: Iea5a1559e9bece2c0f310170f05260a978e27b47
Closes-bug: #1805400
Partial-bug: #1805880

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I8831476757575fd54fc07154450c6d545fbe6463
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Set FW group admin-state UP by default

By default, the admin state of a new firwall group should be UP.
This patch mark the checkbox.

Change-Id: Id377c656788e0fbb13c4b8f90dd022e39c50adbf
Closes-bug: #1833374

In deployment-novncproxy.yaml, it set hostNetwork = true.
In some cases, we may want to let it use cluster network instead of
hostNetwork.
We'd better add a config item, so that client can override it to use
cluster network based on an operators preferences.

Story: 2006490
Task: 36439

Change-Id: Ia235d4e9542bd9242f9d2713ad1e67870f3016e2

In deployment-novncproxy.yaml, it set hostNetwork = true.
In some cases, we may want to let it use cluster network instead of
hostNetwork.
We'd better add a config item, so that client can override it to use
cluster network based on an operators preferences.

Below test pass in starlingx project.
Override this flag to false and let novncproxy use cluster network
instead of hostnetwork, access to vm console through horizon directly
can work!

commit_message:
Add a config item for novncproxy

In deployment-novncproxy.yaml, it set hostNetwork = true.
In some cases, we may want to let it use cluster network instead of
hostNetwork.
We'd better add a config item, so that client can override it to use
cluster network based on an operators preferences.

Story: 2006490
Task: 36439

Change-Id: Ia235d4e9542bd9242f9d2713ad1e67870f3016e2
Signed-off-by: zhipengl <zhipengs.liu@intel.com>

commit_message:
Policies Negative Test cases for V3 version

Following Negative test cases added:

1. create policy with invalid policy type.
2. delete non-existent policy.
3. show non-existent policy.
4. update non-existent policy.

Change-Id: Iaa2fda59180b1ab05ae203862eeba1022c7c7d50

I don't see a reason to modify this - this can cover possible bugs, I'm in favor that, if someone wants to ignore the error during cleanups, they should be explicit in adding the ignore handler."}, {'account_id': 8205, 'date': '2017-02-17 16:22:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I don't see a reason to modify this - this can cover possible bugs,
 > I'm in favor that, if someone wants to ignore the error during
 > cleanups, they should be explicit in adding the ignore handler.

This is only for cleanup and it does not cover possible bugs.
In some delete type test cases, if resource is deleted in test case then created resource cleanup should be ignored during addCleaup. 
In tempest you can find numerous of such cases.

That's why this changes are added.
Please revisit your review comment."}, {'account_id': 11022, 'date': '2017-02-17 18:09:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > I don't see a reason to modify this - this can cover possible
 > bugs,
 > > I'm in favor that, if someone wants to ignore the error during
 > > cleanups, they should be explicit in adding the ignore handler.
 > 
 > This is only for cleanup and it does not cover possible bugs.
 > In some delete type test cases, if resource is deleted in test case
 > then created resource cleanup should be ignored during addCleaup.
 > In tempest you can find numerous of such cases.

Right, what I'm saying is that I prefer that, in such cases, the test is clearly setting the ignore flag. Use this for all cases is not safe IMHO.

commit_message:
Exception Free Identity Resource Cleanup

In the identity api base module, during identity resource's (user/role etc.)
addCleanup, we are calling clients directly for identity resource deletion.

If some delete identity resource type tests are using these methods resouce creation,
It can cause a problem.

This patch provides fix for this.

Change-Id: I9b320f6b909e0968f62bcca73a17b84eba674720

[{'account_id': 23944, 'date': '2017-12-05 13:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-05 13:57:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Pass scheduler hints as a parameter to the API create volume request

This patch implements passing scheduler hints, such as same_host or
different_hosts, to the API create_volume request.

Implements: blueprint create-volume-scheduler-hints

Change-Id: Ib67df18ff26c766d2e26884edf42a599e3e51b51

commit_message:
Use addClassResourceCleanup for cleanup in test_domain_configuration

This is to use addClassResourceCleanup in test_domain_configuration.py
so the resource_cleanup can be removed.

Change-Id: I2f86eb2b3302322205d258e196e38411bd750c49

For the empty response cases, you could do something like the following.

- http://paste.openstack.org/show/603822/

Nova uses those dates to build a WHERE clause like he following.

    WHERE (instances.terminated_at IS NULL OR instances.terminated_at > '2016-09-28 21:02:51') AND instances.launched_at < '2016-09-28 21:02:51';

Anyhoo, hope that helps & I'm not stepping on your toes. Mostly, I'm just avoiding having to work on tripleo :)"}, {'account_id': 7020, 'date': '2017-03-23 16:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7020, 'date': '2017-03-23 16:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 7020, 'date': '2017-03-23 16:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

@Diana thanks a lot for the great review. I decided to go with your version for the marker tests.

For the empty test, I just passed the tenant id of alt_user (with the assumption that it returns an empty response).

Have fun with tripleo ;)'}, {'account_id': 16907, 'date': '2017-03-23 17:53:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

Is it safe to assume no instances? What about parallel test runs?

I was under the impression that it's possible for other test classes to be creating instances at the same time, but perhaps I'm thinking of the python-novalcient functional tests.

Anyhoo, that's why I used the wonky start/end dates approach to test the empty response cases, and also why I used assertGreaterEqual in the marker tests (instances leaking from parallel test runs)."}, {'account_id': 16907, 'date': '2017-03-23 17:56:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Going over the Credential Provider doc[1], it seems to me that the only way os_alt tenant would have instances assigned to it, is if the operator is using the Pre-Provisioned credentials with projects that were initially not empty. I don't know if that's an issue or not, but I suspect similar behavior can break several more tests.

I guess we can wait for input from someone with more experience on Tempest to tell us.

usage API.

'}, {'created': '2017-04-06 13:39:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add tests for compute v2.40 microversion

Nova microversion 2.40 adds pagination support to the simple tenant
usage API.

Details of v2.40 microversion can be found here:
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_history.html

The patch also corrects an error in the tenant_usage schema that was
causing link traversal to fail. The response schema incorrectly assumed
that empty usage responses were invalid.

Change-Id: Iec40f819f8ecf34ead7dcfc61a06ca62457ff958
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add tests for compute v2.40 microversion

Nova microversion 2.40 adds pagination support to the simple tenant
usage API.

Details of v2.40 microversion can be found here:
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_history.html

The patch also corrects an error in the tenant_usage schema that was
causing link traversal to fail. The response schema incorrectly assumed
that empty usage responses were invalid.

Change-Id: Iec40f819f8ecf34ead7dcfc61a06ca62457ff958
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Glance reuse deleted image-member by other project

Testcase steps:
Create an image by primary project
Add two image-members to the image and verify members
Remove primary image-member from image and verify members
Create a new image by alt_project
Add to the glance alt_project an image-member that was deleted
by the other project.

Change-Id: I44e152b88a84ee2cd0301d4d0c1b71d01c171f79

[{'created': '2017-02-23 21:40:56.000000000', 'message': 'Modification to min_prefixlen for subnetpool

According to neutron API reference([1]_), value of default_prefixlen
is equal to min_prefixlen. By default min_prefixlen defaults to 8.

According to [2]_ default_prefixlen has to be validated when creating
subnetpool. In this test case subnetpool prefix was 16 but
default_prefixlen is 8(default) therefore validation fails.

Default value of default_prefixlen has been set to 16, which is
a valid value.

[1]_ : https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/?expanded=create-subnet-pool-detail#create-subnet-pool
[2]_ : https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1644433

Change-Id: I4bc3320659a506386415d8f56dcc88742bdcd58b
Partial-bug: #1644433
'}]
commit_message:
Modification to min_prefixlen for subnetpool

According to neutron API reference([1]_), value of default_prefixlen
is equal to min_prefixlen. By default min_prefixlen defaults to 8.

According to [2]_ default_prefixlen has to be validated when creating
subnetpool. In this test case subnetpool prefix was 16 but
default_prefixlen is 8(default) therefore validation fails.

Default value of default_prefixlen has been set to 16, which is
a valid value.

[1]_ : https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/?expanded=create-subnet-pool-detail#create-subnet-pool
[2]_ : https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1644433

Change-Id: I4bc3320659a506386415d8f56dcc88742bdcd58b
Partial-bug: #1644433

commit_message:
Fix test_rescue_unrescue_instance in juno

In juno release, the rescue tests are
failing.
Even if enable_instance_password
is set to False, rescue instance action is
returning a password.
Additional properties should be allowed.

Change-Id: I01dad58988d55fe2ba55649e9fcfd4591eee332d
Closes-Bug: #1657371

commit_message:
Adds GET/LIST resources tests to telemetry

This submission adds a test case
"test_list_and_get_resources" for list and get
operations on Resources.

Thus a new directory admin is added under
"tempest/api/telemetry/admin"

Change-Id: I77d3ff507bb6a390973b571e5bdcd9106bc3b4ef

[{'created': '2019-09-13 13:00:20.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the deprecation messages of local dir config

The deprecation messages of node_staging_uri and work_dir
were claiming that local directory is not needed after moving
to multistore. This is not exactly true and gave false
expectations of the current capabilities.

For now only the way to configure those needed folder and
how they are internally accessed is changing.

This change corrects the deprecation message to reflect
current state.

Change-Id: I39c170903c64181841a22c7b9bdaa3b5a1346caa
Closes-Bug: #1843891
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the deprecation messages of local dir config

The deprecation messages of node_staging_uri and work_dir
were claiming that local directory is not needed after moving
to multistore. This is not exactly true and gave false
expectations of the current capabilities.

For now only the way to configure those needed folder and
how they are internally accessed is changing.

This change corrects the deprecation message to reflect
current state.

Change-Id: I39c170903c64181841a22c7b9bdaa3b5a1346caa
Closes-Bug: #1843891

commit_message:
Skip querying resource request in revert_resize if no qos port

During revert_resize we can skip collecting port resource requests
from neutron if there is no port with allocation key in the binding
profile in the network info caches of the instance.

Note that we cannot do the same optimization in the MigrationTask as we
would like to use migration to heal missing port allocations. See more
in bug #1819923.

Change-Id: I72d0e28f3b9319e521243d7d0dc5dfa4feaf56f5
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

commit_message:
Improve dest service level func tests

As a follow up for Ia69dace6d3b395fa113c1382e8eb52c2cc36119d and
Id0ee10e8d323786f4d79c82e3f05b48e76bd0956 the functional test for
destination compute service level check behavior is improved and
documented a bit better.

Change-Id: I406a4e812993682dfb5021ef931cce91e343463e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-12 08:24:58.000000000', 'message': "Make SRIOV computes non symmetric in func test

The FakeDriverWithPciResources creates 3 PFs with VFs for each compute
in a symmetric way. For example PF1 in every compute has a device name
'ens1'. When a server with SRIOV ports with resource request is booted
the PCI request of the server is updated to point to the PF dev name
that provides the bandwidth for the port. When such a server is migrated
this reference needs to be updated according to the destination host
resource allocation. As the compute were symmetric the update was a
no-op (e.g. from ens1 on the source to the ens1 on the destination
host). This prevent us to properly assert that the migration did the
update.

So this patch breaks the symmetry by appending the hostname to the PF
device names.

Change-Id: Id801d36f96b16708458db8549ce03abd308bc119
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports
"}, {'created': '2019-09-12 10:48:12.000000000', 'message': "Make SRIOV computes non symmetric in func test

the PCI request of the server is updated to point to the PF dev name
that provides the bandwidth for the port. When such a server is migrated
this reference needs to be updated according to the destination host
resource allocation. As the compute were symmetric the update was a
no-op (e.g. from ens1 on the source to the ens1 on the destination
host). This prevent us to properly assert that the migration did the
update.

So this patch breaks the symmetry by appending the hostname to the PF
device names.

Change-Id: Id801d36f96b16708458db8549ce03abd308bc119
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports
"}]
commit_message:
Make SRIOV computes non symmetric in func test

The FakeDriverWithPciResources creates 3 PFs with VFs for each compute
in a symmetric way. For example PF1 in every compute has a device name
'ens1'. When a server with SRIOV ports with resource request is booted
the PCI request of the server is updated to point to the PF dev name
that provides the bandwidth for the port. When such a server is migrated
this reference needs to be updated according to the destination host
resource allocation. As the compute were symmetric the update was a
no-op (e.g. from ens1 on the source to the ens1 on the destination
host). This prevent us to properly assert that the migration did the
update.

So this patch breaks the symmetry by appending the hostname to the PF
device names.

Change-Id: Id801d36f96b16708458db8549ce03abd308bc119
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

[{'created': '2019-08-28 10:02:35.000000000', 'message': 'Allow resizing server with port resource request

This patch adds functional coverage for such resize. No extra code
changes was needed top of the migrate patches to make resize work.

Now that the nova code supports the resize this patch removes the
check from the API that rejected the operation.

Note that in the spec [1] we agreed not to introduce new microversion
for this change but treat it as a bugfix. The current change also makes
it possible to accept the resize of these servers with _any_
microversion.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/support-move-ops-with-qos-ports.html#rest-api-impact

commit_message:
Allow resizing server with port resource request

This patch adds functional coverage for such resize. No extra code
changes were needed on top of the migrate patches to make resize work.

Now that the nova code supports the resize this patch removes the
check from the API that rejected the operation.

Note that in the spec [1] we agreed not to introduce new microversion
for this change but treat it as a bugfix. The current change also makes
it possible to accept the resize of these servers with _any_
microversion.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/support-move-ops-with-qos-ports.html#rest-api-impact

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

commit_message:
Allow migrating server with port resource request

Now that the nova code supports such a migration this patch removes the
check from the API that rejected the operation.

Note that in the spec [1] we agreed not to introduce new microversion
for this change but treat it as a bugfix. The current change also makes
it possible to accept the migration of these servers with _any_
microversion.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/support-move-ops-with-qos-ports.html#rest-api-impact

Change-Id: I4bda569cc7c247e83219276282724c77e760ddcd
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

'}, {'created': '2019-09-11 18:20:05.000000000', 'message': 'Support migrating SRIOV port with bandwidth

For normal ports with resource request it is enough to recalculate the
provider mapping during cold migrations. But for ports with PCI request
(direct, macvtap) the PCI request also needs to be updated to point to
the PF that provides the bandwidth on the destiantion host. So that the
pci claim on the compute allocates the VF from the same PF that provides
the bandwidth resource.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: I2f3434f06489d8b6cb80933bcb1ea1e841049ba5
'}, {'created': '2019-09-12 10:50:40.000000000', 'message': 'Support migrating SRIOV port with bandwidth

For normal ports with resource request it is enough to recalculate the
provider mapping during cold migrations. But for ports with PCI request
(direct, macvtap) the PCI request also needs to be updated to point to
the PF that provides the bandwidth on the destiantion host. So that the
pci claim on the compute allocates the VF from the same PF that provides
the bandwidth resource.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: I2f3434f06489d8b6cb80933bcb1ea1e841049ba5
'}, {'created': '2019-09-12 14:36:48.000000000', 'message': 'Support migrating SRIOV port with bandwidth

For normal ports with resource request it is enough to recalculate the
provider mapping during cold migrations. But for ports with PCI request
(direct, macvtap) the PCI request also needs to be updated to point to
the PF that provides the bandwidth on the destiantion host. So that the
pci claim on the compute allocates the VF from the same PF that provides
the bandwidth resource.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: I2f3434f06489d8b6cb80933bcb1ea1e841049ba5
'}]
commit_message:
Support migrating SRIOV port with bandwidth

For normal ports with resource request it is enough to recalculate the
provider mapping during cold migrations. But for ports with PCI request
(direct, macvtap) the PCI request also needs to be updated to point to
the PF that provides the bandwidth on the destiantion host. So that the
pci claim on the compute allocates the VF from the same PF that provides
the bandwidth resource.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: I2f3434f06489d8b6cb80933bcb1ea1e841049ba5

commit_message:
Fix a misuse of assertGreaterEqual

In a notification sample functional test,
there is a misuse of assertGreaterEqual.

At least 6 notifications are expected,
So the order of the arguments should be reversed.

Change-Id: I865c215a13fa3bb72e191382187ea8368885846f
Closes-Bug: #1843885

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 14:09:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix L7 repository create methods

SQLAlchemy can get confused if the parent database objects are not
linked when creating new records using the repository.
For example, when creating an L7 policy, even if you specify the
listener_id, sqlalchemy will drop the ID from the final SQL INSERT
parameter.
This patch corrects the L7 policy and rule create methods to have
the required parent objects linked.

Story: 2006305
Task: 36021

Change-Id: I4380605bdb346eee824b2ce05fa25175c4cc3034
(cherry picked from commit 36afa82d0c9c61aa74ea922fcc769125afebd962)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix L7 repository create methods

SQLAlchemy can get confused if the parent database objects are not
linked when creating new records using the repository.
For example, when creating an L7 policy, even if you specify the
listener_id, sqlalchemy will drop the ID from the final SQL INSERT
parameter.
This patch corrects the L7 policy and rule create methods to have
the required parent objects linked.

Story: 2006305
Task: 36021

Change-Id: I4380605bdb346eee824b2ce05fa25175c4cc3034
(cherry picked from commit 36afa82d0c9c61aa74ea922fcc769125afebd962)

commit_message:
Add PDF documentation build

Add a new tox target to build PDF documentation in accord
with the community goal [0] to have PDF docs available.

Also, only show genindex and search for HTML.  These elements
do not make sense within PDF documents.

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

Change-Id: Ibbd50276c3879958b0ceb82afcc882716c01b384

Add --immutable-roles flag to bootstrap command

This implements Step 2 of the Proposed Change for Immutable
Resources[1].

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/train/immutable-resources.html#proposed-change

Add in support for immutable roles and projects. If the
immutable option is set for a role or a project that
resource may not:

* Be Deleted

* Be Updated, except to change the value of "immutable" from
  `True` to `False` or `None` (None explicitly unsets the
  resource option).

The logic for immutable check is currently at the driver level,
ideally, this should be lifted up to the manager level, but
would require an extra lookup to the backend. This change
will happen in a future change.

Change-Id: I2027b1235a260b7ae5d66cbd6c369773d9e99876
Partial-bug: #1823258
'}, {'created': '2019-08-24 19:16:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add immutable option for roles and projects

  `True` to `False` or `None` (None explicitly unsets the
  resource option).

* For projects (and domains), project tags cannot be created,
  updated, or deleted.

The immutable check is performed at the manager layer allowing
for exceptional code-cases to work directly with the driver.

commit_message:
Add immutable option for roles and projects

Add in support for immutable roles and projects (including domains).
If the immutable option is set for a role or a project that
resource may not:

* Be Deleted

* Be Updated, except to change the value of "immutable" from
  `True` to `False` or `None` (None explicitly unsets the
  resource option).

* For projects (and domains), project tags cannot be created,
  updated, or deleted.

The immutable check is performed at the manager layer allowing
for exceptional code-cases to work directly with the driver.

Change-Id: I2027b1235a260b7ae5d66cbd6c369773d9e99876
Partial-bug: #1823258

commit_message:
Add PDF documentation build

Add a new tox target to build PDF documentation in accord
with the community goal [0] to have PDF docs available.

Also, only show genindex and search for HTML.  These elements
do not make sense within PDF documents.

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

Change-Id: I5ab7adc8cfd19e02bc8e7c9abf1eb38c4f3409fb

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 20:55:44.000000000', 'message': "tests/py3: Improve header casing

Previously, our unit tests with socket servers would let eventlet
capitalize headers on the way out, which

- isn't something we want to have eventlet do, because it
- breaks unicode-in-header-names on py3, so it
- is already disabled in swift.common.wsgi.run_server() for real servers.

Include a test to make sure we don't forget about it in the future.

Change-Id: I0156d0059092ed414b296c65fb70fc18533b074a
"}, {'created': '2019-08-26 21:44:17.000000000', 'message': "tests/py3: Improve header casing

Previously, our unit tests with socket servers would let eventlet
capitalize headers on the way out, which

- isn't something we want to have eventlet do, because it

- is already disabled in swift.common.wsgi.run_server() for real servers.

Include a test to make sure we don't forget about it in the future.

Change-Id: I0156d0059092ed414b296c65fb70fc18533b074a
"}]
commit_message:
tests/py3: Improve header casing

Previously, our unit tests with socket servers would let eventlet
capitalize headers on the way out, which

- isn't something we want to have eventlet do, because it
- breaks unicode-in-header-names on py3, so it
- is already disabled in swift.common.wsgi.run_server() for real servers.

Include a test to make sure we don't forget about it in the future.

Change-Id: I0156d0059092ed414b296c65fb70fc18533b074a

commit_message:
Add CLI commands for Share Networks with multiple Subnets

- Added CLI commands for subnets creation, deletion and exhibition.
- Updated commands for share server manage and added a new
  parameter to share server list.

API microverion has been bumped to 2.51.

Closes-Bug: #1588144
Partially-implements: bp share-network-multiple-subnets
Change-Id: I55c85285cbdc9aaf2c0bab2f12477212b32b799a
Depends-On: Id8814a8b26c9b9dcb1fe71d0d7e9b79e8b8a9210

commit_message:
Add label to namespaces

This patch set adds the ability to add a label to the following namespaces:

- kube-public
- kube-system
- default

This was previously done in kubeadm in patch [0] but appears to be
removed as the script moved around. Also, this PS adds this to the
minikube deployment.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/540131/

Change-Id: I0f06e8ae0cd7742313b447dc2d563c7d92318fb0
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

subject: pass default_config_dirs variable for config initialization.
messages:
[{'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-05-10 12:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-11 23:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Is it possible to add a test for this?'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2019-05-13 02:25:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is this related to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657374/?'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-05-13 08:58:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Is it possible to add a test for this?

The test would end up testing the find_config_dirs call.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-05-13 08:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Is this related to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657374/?

No'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-05-13 09:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-05-13 09:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-15 14:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-15 14:06:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

OK the python-watcher thing clears this up (thanks for the commit message update). If it were me I'd still try to write a unit test because if this is worth fixing it's worth having a test to make sure it's not regressed when something changes in this module, like a refactor, but I won't block on it either since I realize the test wouldn't be doing a whole lot besides asserting the code is doing what it is supposed to."}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-15 15:32:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So if I understand correctly with this patch watcher should load config files from /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d/.

I just tried the patch but couldn't get the configuration to be loaded from /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d/

Do I need to specify the --config-dir paramaeter or is there a default value?
Is the /etc/watcher/watcher.conf file loaded with a higher priority?
Do the files /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d/ need to have a specific name?"}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2019-05-16 06:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

In what scenario we need /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d?'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-05-16 11:23:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dantali0n wrote:

> So if I understand correctly with this patch watcher should load
> config files from /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d/.

should be able to, but not mandatory to have your config files in that folder

> I just tried the patch but couldn't get the configuration to be
> loaded from /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d/

If you have provided --config-dir option oslo_config will go look in that folder.
here is an example of how it works

```

linux:~ # python
Python 2.7.13 (default, Jan 11 2017, 10:56:06) [GCC] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from oslo_config import cfg
>>> cfg.find_config_files(project='watcher')
['/etc/watcher/watcher.conf']
>>> cfg.find_config_dirs(project='watcher')
['/etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d']
>>> 
linux:~ # ls /etc/watcher/*
/etc/watcher/policy.yaml.sample  /etc/watcher/watcher.conf  /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.sample

/etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d:
100-watcher.conf
linux:~ # 

```

So now you can  oslo_config will load conf files from /etc/watcher and /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d/

and options defined in /etc/watcher/watcher.conf take precedence over those defined in conf.d directory.

There is more infor here - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/ocata/cfg.html#loading-config-files'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-16 11:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks for the explanation got it to work.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-05-17 07:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-05-17 09:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-09-13 22:44:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit ec5780902ff99135e4883a6c45b3190bf6f7c5cb'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-10 12:39:28.000000000', 'message': "pass default_config_dirs variable for config initialization.

Currently default config files are being for initialization of CONF from
oslo_config. However default config dirs are not being passed as a
result watcher components (eg: decision-engine) are unable to load
files from default directories (eg: /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d)
supported by oslo_config. This is a short-coming on watcher's side.
Also this forces user to have multiple config for each component.

This patch adds the option after evaluating using project as 'watcher'
which is similar to evaluation of default_config_files and also allows
it to be passed in as a function parameter.

Change-Id: I013f9d03978f8716847f8d1ee6888629faf5779b
"}, {'created': '2019-05-13 09:09:47.000000000', 'message': "pass default_config_dirs variable for config initialization.

Currently default config files are being for initialization of CONF from
oslo_config. However default config dirs are not being passed as a
result watcher components (eg: decision-engine) are unable to load
files from default directories (eg: /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d)
supported by oslo_config. This is a short-coming on watcher's side.
Also this forces user to have multiple config for each component.

Without this default set, oslo_config will search for conf with string
'python-watcher' in it, eg: /etc/python-watcher/.... Since there is a
because project=python-watcher a couple of lines below

This patch adds the option after evaluating using project as 'watcher'
which is similar to evaluation of default_config_files and also allows
it to be passed in as a function parameter.

Change-Id: I013f9d03978f8716847f8d1ee6888629faf5779b
"}]
commit_message:
pass default_config_dirs variable for config initialization.

Currently default config files are being for initialization of CONF from
oslo_config. However default config dirs are not being passed as a
result watcher components (eg: decision-engine) are unable to load
files from default directories (eg: /etc/watcher/watcher.conf.d)
supported by oslo_config. This is a short-coming on watcher's side.
Also this forces user to have multiple config for each component.

Without this default set, oslo_config will search for conf with string
'python-watcher' in it, eg: /etc/python-watcher/.... Since there is a
because project=python-watcher a couple of lines below

This patch adds the option after evaluating using project as 'watcher'
which is similar to evaluation of default_config_files and also allows
it to be passed in as a function parameter.

Change-Id: I013f9d03978f8716847f8d1ee6888629faf5779b

commit_message:
Rename 1.7.0 to 2.0.0

As OpenStack release team suggested, as for backward incomaptible
changes we need to change major version.

+ get back jsoncshcema draft-4 as default, since it can break all
plugins at once.

Change-Id: Id1eadb69964c630f119eb00d5a7f69fac64ba825

commit_message:
[NetApp] Adds support for replication with DHSS=True

This patch adds support for replication with DHSS=True on
NetApp driver. It now handles peering operations between
share servers and shares.

Change-Id: I93888bcc6a0ca672671cf2aa254ceb23c4cbf692

subject: Add share network with multiple subnets

(6 comments)

Goutham, thanks for the review.
Regarding the DellEMC_Unity_Manila_dhss_True jobs that are failing, I saw that their tempest tests are running with MAX_API_MICROVERSION="2.50" when it should be configure to run with "2.49". In order to have it running on "2.50" they need to cherry-pick the manila-tempest-plugin latest commit from change #676475.
NetApp CI is testing if the "2.49" wasn't broken with this change, while in manila-tempest-plugin change we test if the old and new tests are passing in microversion "2.50".'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-09-10 17:47:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

I think we're going to need to bump the microversion here because (crossing fingers) the share-type update stuff merge is imminent.

Looking at the remaining issues, I'm wondering if we can raise an LP bug for them and address them next week after feature freeze.  I see issues with exception path handling, a typo in a policy, a missing field in the network subnet view, need for some decorators, doc string fixes, a user message fix, and some relatively minor unit test fixes.

If we defer fixing these till next week do we break anything w.r.t. the changes that depend on this one when we fix them?"}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2019-09-10 23:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2019-09-10 23:24:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

(78 comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-16 13:52:08.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add share network with multiple subnets

WIP WIP WIP
This patch adds the possibility to create share networks with
multiple subnets in Manila. It also updates the share server api
to receive "share_network_subnet_id" instead of "share_network_id".

Each share network subnet must be associated with only one
availability zone. Each share network must have a single default
share network subnet.
WIP WIP WIP

Partially-implements: bp share-network-multiple-subnets
Change-Id: Id8814a8b26c9b9dcb1fe71d0d7e9b79e8b8a9210

commit_message:
Add share network with multiple subnets

This patch adds the possibility to create share networks with
multiple subnets in Manila. It also updates the share server api
to receive "share_network_subnet_id" instead of "share_network_id".

Each share network subnet must be associated with only one
availability zone. Each share network must have a single default
share network subnet.

DocImpact
APIImpact
Depends-On: I13bb48e7c03e16c26946ccf9d48e80592391a3d1
Partially-implements: bp share-network-multiple-subnets
Change-Id: Id8814a8b26c9b9dcb1fe71d0d7e9b79e8b8a9210
Closes-Bug: #1588144
Co-Authored-By: lseki <luciomitsuru.seki@fit-tecnologia.org.br>
Co-Authored-By: dviroel <viroel@gmail.com>

subject: Releasing python-swiftclient 3.8.1
messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-09-12 16:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-12 21:04:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looks good, just need PTL or release liaison ack. Minor version bump needed to allow for stable/stein backports.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-09-12 21:21:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'd rather have this include https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679900/ for the PDF-docs community goal if we can. Ideally, we could also get an AUTHORS/ChangeLog patch in to document the two bugs fixed, but with an 11+-hour wait time for checks, that seems optimistic.

Honestly, I think I'd prefer to just let 3.8.0 stand as our Train release."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-12 21:28:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Tim. My mistake too on the minor version bump - I didn't notice there was already a release in train, so I agree that this should only be a bugfix increment.

If we just went with the last release, that would mean needing to branch stable/train from that point and any commits to python-swiftclient since they would end up being part of the ussuri release. I'm guessing that's probably not what you really want.

Doc updates get published on every commit, so the PDF stuff should be picked up. Nice to have in stable/train, but probably not the end of the world.

Are the other things you would like to have in train already in flight? We can wait a while if needed, but today is the client lib freeze so something should get released."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-12 21:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-12 22:08:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Waiting on update from Tim.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-09-12 23:01:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There have been four non-merge patches since the previous release:

 7875398 Delete/overwrite symlinks better (by Tim Burke, 7 weeks ago)
 7175069 Fix up requests so we can send non-RFC-compliant headers on py3 (by Tim Burke, 7 weeks ago)
 5bd6694 Drag forward prettytable in lower-constraints (by Tim Burke, 7 weeks ago)
 efe3d08 Add Python 3 Train unit tests (by Corey Bryant, 10 weeks ago)

The first two are non-critical bug fixes. The first has been present since symlinks were introduced to swift in queens; the fact that no one had reported the issue and instead it was a drive-by fix during a review tells me that it's low-priority. The second, it seems no one but swift's own tests is crazy enough to request.

The third is a lower-constraints update due entirely to a transitive-dep (by way of extras, no less!) unpublishing a version from pypi.

The fourth is chiefly clerical.

All of that is to say, I really, truly meant to say that waiting for ussuri is fine. I can work on getting a 3.8.1 authors/changelog patch up and update this with the new SHA and version, but the chief motivator is avoiding the need for an immediate backport because a package outside our control did something stupid with build artifacts and we were foolish enough years ago to depend it."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-09-13 02:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-13 13:55:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-09-13 20:47:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-13 20:48:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

You'll need to update the patch now with the new commit hash."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-09-13 21:11:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-13 21:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks!'}]

commit_message:
Add failover logging to show the amphora details.

When failover occurs, Octavia health-manager doesn't log any
information about the loadbalancer.  Due to this, operators can't
specify which loadbalancer got failed and which user was affected
by the failover.

This commit fix this issue by logging not only amphora_id but also
the linking information (e.g. loadbalancer_id, compute_id, ..)
when performing/completed the failover.

Change-Id: I9bdd6f2913c0da2b0772b4b694309ef993289360
Task: 34312
Story: 2005947
(cherry picked from commit 93e06a9239a0f4b2bcdcdca9e13e800e75b1f237)
(cherry picked from commit f412d8521c79d9361c86dc1a1d74a119b1942b7c)
(cherry picked from commit 7722133fb2fa63a5ae486c379ddb08262ad5f996)

commit_message:
Implement domain admin support for grants

This commit goes through and updates grant policies to allow domain
administrator to manager grants for their domains and projects within
thier domain.

Co-Authored-By: Colleen Murphy <colleen@gazlene.net>

Change-Id: I5f1839a3f8d23d17e449aa9f8710d70233ee8fcc
Closes-Bug: 1805368
Closes-Bug: 1750669

(2 comments)

One comment on a duplicated test. The added testing is great.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-09-11 14:47:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

I figured out what's breaking this for me locally. We might need to discuss how to handle it though.

My local configuration was enabling domain-specific drivers [0][1], which was getting picked up during the tests. List users and list groups both try and extract a domain ID in the API code [2][3]. That calls a common utility method for extracting domain IDs [4] and by default that method short-circuits because we don't ship with domain-specific drivers enabled (hence why Zuul is not hitting these failures.)

At first glance, it appears that [4] doesn't know how to handle domain ID extraction when dealing with system-scoped tokens.

Should we introduce a patch to address that case in [4] and rebase this series? Or should we merge this first and fix the domain-specific failures later?

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/branch/master/keystone/conf/identity.py#L32-L43
[1] https://pasted.tech/pastes/e8ffce7a3377b960dd88de8c88e2ccfd173ec726.raw
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/branch/master/keystone/api/groups.py#L84
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/branch/master/keystone/api/users.py#L176
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/branch/master/keystone/server/flask/common.py#L917-L943"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-09-11 14:48:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> I figured out what's breaking this for me locally. We might need to
 > discuss how to handle it though.
 > 
 > My local configuration was enabling domain-specific drivers [0][1],
 > which was getting picked up during the tests. List users and list
 > groups both try and extract a domain ID in the API code [2][3].
 > That calls a common utility method for extracting domain IDs [4]
 > and by default that method short-circuits because we don't ship
 > with domain-specific drivers enabled (hence why Zuul is not hitting
 > these failures.)
 > 
 > At first glance, it appears that [4] doesn't know how to handle
 > domain ID extraction when dealing with system-scoped tokens.
 > 
 > Should we introduce a patch to address that case in [4] and rebase
 > this series? Or should we merge this first and fix the
 > domain-specific failures later?
 > 
 > [0] https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/branch/master/keystone/conf/identity.py#L32-L43
 > [1] https://pasted.tech/pastes/e8ffce7a3377b960dd88de8c88e2ccfd173ec726.raw

Fully disclosure - I'm only putting a -1 on this so we can discuss it, but I'm fine with either approach."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-09-11 15:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-09-11 15:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

Implement domain reader support for grants

This commit adds testing and policy changes for domain users to be
able to manage grants within their domain.

commit_message:
Report openstack/election repo changes in IRC

Changes to the openstack/election repository are of interest to the
technical governance of the OpenStack project, so report them in all
IRC channels where changes for the openstack/governance repository
are also reported (#openstack-dev, #openstack-merges
and #openstack-tc).

Change-Id: I4a90c222019325e25e75ce25420ba0f4ad3c1100

commit_message:
Tighten formatting for new branch reno page title

Some have pointed out that the generated page title is not strictly
correct for a valid RST title. This adds some additional formatting of
the text to make sure it is completely valid.

Change-Id: I8652be3dc987629a8acca7a1584086fc4e2f4636

commit_message:
Stop sending execution object via Zaqar message

Execution object can be quite large which is not suitable
for sending via Zaqar messages. Instead we're sending
execution_id and root_execution_id which can be used by the client
to retrieve execution details

Depends-On: Ia6c954e688589f69a7463f1b8e02244d029e8b7a
Change-Id: I010ea5d732aba97a554e868f62a19e6fdaee8889

commit_message:
Add new algorithm SOURCE_IP_PORT

LB_ALGORITHM_SOURCE_IP_PORT is an algorithm used by OVN
Load Balancer [0]. This patch adds its support to the API.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660369
Depends-On: I605f44f0f50219aa003df477de9bae4062f3c308

Change-Id: I436a6e553065d1755d465d20ad36f7ba2cbb8eba
Task: 35952
Story: 2006264

commit_message:
Wrap several show api calls with correct_return_codes

Loadbalancer show API call can also raise 'incorrect' exception, so it
would be nice to wrap it with a helper decorator.

Also, this patch extends correct_return_codes decorator to cover
wrong usage of NotFound exception at osc-lib
(see https://review.opendev.org/675328)

Change-Id: If2565df22c2677bbad09f3eafacc148c740c0124

commit_message:
Fix nova-conductor healthcheck RPC port

It currently assumes the default RPCPort.

Change-Id: Idbb1738db0f4cc3efb9005c2bfee188d3a9ef5be
Closes-Bug: #1843890

Patch is good and I'd be fine merging as-is, -1 is for a suggestion for hopefully improving it:

How about we get the orig_instance_uuid at the API level, where we know we have access to the api database and don't need to handle that db_exc, and then pass both instances down to the network API?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-05 17:51:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

> How about we get the orig_instance_uuid at the API level, where we know we have access to the api database and don't need to handle that db_exc, and then pass both instances down to the network API?

That's quite a bit bigger and probably not so fun to backport change, impacts the internal network API stuff (for both base/nova-net/neutron) and in most cases won't even be a problem since most deployments aren't running multiple cells, so it seems like a lot of work for something that is really an edge case for 90%+ of deployments."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-05 17:53:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Artom, also, keep in mind this whole refresh the cache for the old instance is completely best effort so I don't think we really need to bend over backward for it."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-09-05 17:59:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Ah, hadn't thought of the backport implications."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-09-05 18:17:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(4 comments)

I'll +2 this to enable the backports, but after looking in more detail, I definitely agree that this is not the way we should be doing this in cases where we can avoid it in some way. I haven't looked at all the plumbing to get here to see what all would have to change to have the API do this lookup for us, but I'd like to see some comment about why that's infeasible. You're adding an upcall, which goes against our goals, and just making it kinda quiet to avoid setting off the alarms."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-05 19:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-09-05 19:58:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think Matt is going to tweak this before it lands for a cleaner backport, but I'll leave my +2 on here and let him bump it if he wants so as not to have this roll through the gate and not land late."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-05 20:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-30 21:48:45.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Find instance in another cell during floating IP re-association

When associating a floating IP to instance A but it was already
associated with instance B, we try to refresh the info cache on
instance B. The problem is the context is targeted to the cell
for instance A and instance B might be in another cell, so we'll
get an InstanceNotFound error trying to lookup instance B.

This change tries to find the instance in another cell using its
instance mapping, and makes the code a bit more graceful if
instance B is deleted or if this code, for whatever reason,
does not have access to the API DB (the latter part is really about
future proofing this code because right now it's only called by the
API which definitely should have access to the API DB).

Change-Id: I71790afd0784d98050ccd7cc0e046321da249cbe
Closes-Bug: #1826472

commit_message:
Find instance in another cell during floating IP re-association

When associating a floating IP to instance A but it was already
associated with instance B, we try to refresh the info cache on
instance B. The problem is the context is targeted to the cell
for instance A and instance B might be in another cell, so we'll
get an InstanceNotFound error trying to lookup instance B.

This change tries to find the instance in another cell using its
instance mapping, and makes the code a bit more graceful if
instance B is deleted.

Change-Id: I71790afd0784d98050ccd7cc0e046321da249cbe
Closes-Bug: #1826472
