commit_message:
Add config option use_dumb_init to add it to container images

Usage of dumb-init can also be disabled from cli with
`--nouse-dumb-init` when building images.

Change-Id: Id32d54fc9913b83cf121ede5a5e265e0772062ae
Related-Bug: #1821970
(cherry picked from commit fb4cb9efda5a522ba0d837047385b61275d09150)

commit_message:
py3: encode messages on py3

On python3 send fails with TypeError: a bytes-like object is required,
not 'str', this patch solves this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1820154
Change-Id: I700462a9a5bcc66b2edf05e4e0396556e381a8c1
(cherry picked from commit 852c8098ca50a2879776cb5437db1271c9a9d8e5)

commit_message:
fix stable/stein gate

This patch gets the stable/stein branch working by adding the in-repo
zuul job config as well as updating the requirements and bindep.txt
for the gate.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-07 16:40:51.000000000', 'message': "Disable apparmor on SLE systems

The existing code to disable apparmor on SUSE systems only worked for
openSUSE.  On SLE12 (at least), aa-enabled and aa-teardown are not
available.  Even if they were, it is more idiomatic and robust to use
systemd's interface for stop/disable rather than making assumptions
about the underlying implementation.

So replace the references to aa-enabled and aa-teardown with calls to
systemctl.

Change-Id: I8d99c8d743cc1935324e2e4fcb67efaa5241199e
"}, {'created': '2019-08-08 11:54:41.000000000', 'message': "Make stop/disable of apparmor work on all SLE systems

The existing code to disable apparmor on SUSE systems only worked for
recent openSUSE / SLE releases.  On SLE12 (at least), aa-enabled and
aa-teardown are not available, so instead use systemd's interface for
stop/disable.  However on newer releases, systemctl stop apparmor is a
no-op:

    https://www.suse.com/releasenotes/x86_64/SUSE-SLES/15/#fate-325343
    https://gitlab.com/apparmor/apparmor/merge_requests/81
    https://build.opensuse.org/package/view_file/openSUSE:Leap:15.2/apparmor/apparmor.service?expand=1

So we still need to call aa-teardown if it's available.

Change-Id: I8d99c8d743cc1935324e2e4fcb67efaa5241199e
"}]
commit_message:
Make stop/disable of apparmor work on all SLE systems

The existing code to disable apparmor on SUSE systems only worked for
recent openSUSE / SLE releases.  On SLE12 (at least), aa-enabled and
aa-teardown are not available, so instead use systemd's interface for
stop/disable.  However on newer releases, systemctl stop apparmor is a
no-op:

    https://www.suse.com/releasenotes/x86_64/SUSE-SLES/15/#fate-325343
    https://gitlab.com/apparmor/apparmor/merge_requests/81
    https://build.opensuse.org/package/view_file/openSUSE:Leap:15.2/apparmor/apparmor.service?expand=1

So we still need to call aa-teardown if it's available.

Change-Id: I8d99c8d743cc1935324e2e4fcb67efaa5241199e

We seem to be running out of disk space in standalone jobs on IPA.
Since we're creating 12 virtual disks here, reduce each to 5 GiB.

Change-Id: Iceebf246b000cf77cbbf62e4edb9b06ee9dd7b71
"}, {'created': '2019-09-11 09:35:52.000000000', 'message': "Combined gate fixes

We seem to be running out of disk space in standalone and mutlinode
jobs. Since we're creating a lot of virtual disks here, reduce each
to 5 GiB. No jobs need so much anyway.

Then correct setting OS_TEST_TIMEOUT in the multinode job. DevStack
variables do not affect tox runs, we need to use a new tempest
role variable instead.

Change-Id: Iceebf246b000cf77cbbf62e4edb9b06ee9dd7b71
"}, {'created': '2019-09-11 09:40:19.000000000', 'message': "Combined gate fixes

We seem to be running out of disk space in standalone and mutlinode
jobs. Since we're creating a lot of virtual disks here, reduce each
to 4 GiB. No jobs need so much anyway. Reducing further will likely
hit issues with IPA assumptions of root devices.

Then correct setting OS_TEST_TIMEOUT in the multinode job. DevStack
variables do not affect tox runs, we need to use a new tempest
role variable instead.

Change-Id: Iceebf246b000cf77cbbf62e4edb9b06ee9dd7b71
"}]
commit_message:
Combined gate fixes

We seem to be running out of disk space in standalone and mutlinode
jobs. Since we're creating a lot of virtual disks here, reduce each
to 4 GiB. No jobs need so much anyway. Reducing further will likely
hit issues with IPA assumptions of root devices.

Then correct setting OS_TEST_TIMEOUT in the multinode job. DevStack
variables do not affect tox runs, we need to use a new tempest
role variable instead.

Change-Id: Iceebf246b000cf77cbbf62e4edb9b06ee9dd7b71

"}, {'created': '2019-09-03 15:41:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix double-digit ODL version number handling for devstack

Latest releases of ODL (Neon: 0.10; Sodium 0.11) snapshots download
fails in case of adding for example 'ODL_RELEASE=neon-snapshot-0.10' to
local.conf. This patch fixes pattern to allow double-digit version

Closes-Bug: #1841760
Change-Id: I0f7fcc49a528cf5c57f11ce9685ddd0e4d559d56

commit_message:
Fix double-digit ODL version number handling for devstack

Latest releases of ODL (Neon: 0.10; Sodium 0.11) snapshots download
fails in case of adding for example 'ODL_RELEASE=neon-snapshot-0.10' to
local.conf. This patch fixes pattern to allow double-digit version
string match.

Closes-Bug: #1841760
Change-Id: I0f7fcc49a528cf5c57f11ce9685ddd0e4d559d56

should be used for x86 architectures.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-13 07:21:02.000000000', 'message': 'magnum: Use type=simple for openstack-magnum-api.service

magnum-api does not support SD_NOTIFY so starting the service hangs
when using type=notify.
Note: mangum-conductor *does* support SD_NOTIFY so keep the type there.

Change-Id: Idd40b0df8c2215bb5ae95c5fb5ef4c2496cdbd12
'}]
commit_message:
magnum: Use type=simple for openstack-magnum-api.service

magnum-api does not support SD_NOTIFY so starting the service hangs
when using type=notify.
Note: mangum-conductor *does* support SD_NOTIFY so keep the type there.

Change-Id: Idd40b0df8c2215bb5ae95c5fb5ef4c2496cdbd12

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I29873a103a676b5f7b4919578610ba6afd82c7a8
Story: #2005924
Task: #34223

commit_message:
[FFU] Fix sensitive hostname in FFU upgrade run command

Hostname is case sensitive in:

    openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes <HOSTNAME>

This can lead to situation when Mistral fails to start node upgrade
due to hostname mismatch.

Change-Id: Ia5253bc6f66a967327fad459b29fe45d88eec780
Closes-Bug: 1802298

> Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in
 > the
 > repo openstack-dev/devstack on branch stable/stein.  The error was:
 > 
 > Nodeset devstack-single-node-fedora-latest does not match existing
 > definition in branch master
 > 
 > The error appears in the following nodeset stanza:
 > 
 > nodeset:
 > name: devstack-single-node-fedora-latest
 > nodes:
 > - name: controller
 > label: fedora-28
 > groups:
 > - name: tempest
 > nodes:
 > - controller
 > 
 > in "openstack-dev/devstack/.zuul.yaml@stable/stein", line 51,
 > column 3

Apparently nodesets cannot differ across branches. Maybe instead of using latest we should just set it to fedora-29 as the name and the node label to fedora-29. Then as newer fedoras show up we can bump it up?'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-04-01 12:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: -Code-Review

The other option might be to move the nodeset definitions to openstack-zuul-jobs or some other unbranched repo (tempest?).

Or we fiddle around and drop them from the stable branches every time?'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-06-04 12:45:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Ian pointed out I had a similar change, https://review.opendev.org/#/c/634626/ and I got around the syntax issue by deleting the nodepool stanza from a dependent patch to stable/stein.  Either way there are issues with consumers that have to be addressed (barbican is one) before we merge something like this.  Don't know which set we want to abandon?"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-09-10 12:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-09-10 13:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-09-13 06:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

034949357f3932b8b7e166e8cbb72b65c149fe33 but not changed here.  How we
could keep these better in sync is an open question ...

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-12 20:08:59.000000000', 'message': 'django22: django.test.client.encode_multipart no longer accepts None

As seen here [1].

When a corresponding field has no selection, an empty string is
passed to the server. This change replaces None with an empty string.

After this change, all tests pass with Django 2.2,
so we can make django22 job voting.

[1] https://github.com/django/django/commit/6fe9c45b725

Change-Id: I4cd551253ac361eaa46b6de35369125eb0e20e98
'}]
commit_message:
django22: django.test.client.encode_multipart no longer accepts None

As seen here [1].

When a corresponding field has no selection, an empty string is
passed to the server. This change replaces None with an empty string.

After this change, all tests pass with Django 2.2,
so we can make django22 job voting.

[1] https://github.com/django/django/commit/6fe9c45b725

Change-Id: I4cd551253ac361eaa46b6de35369125eb0e20e98

commit_message:
[wip] Update for f29

- In Fedora29 dstat was merged with pcp-system-tools (see
https://pagure.io/fesco/issue/1956)
- Obsolete F27

Test-job for F29 can be added only after proper image is deployed
through zuul project-config

Change-Id: Iff28a1d85a8930bdc8eacfc85543dd7836bb004f

Fix PYTHONPATH for Spark

from py36 and py37.

images. Devstack is one of the last projects using this image. Update

Change-Id: Ie70e706083ed1558eb6fc4846e4ac3fab21ecbed
'}, {'created': '2019-08-28 19:17:09.000000000', 'message': 'Use fedora-29 instead of 28

Change-Id: Ie70e706083ed1558eb6fc4846e4ac3fab21ecbed

commit_message:
Use fedora-29 instead of 28

Fedora 28 is EOL and OpenDev is very near to being able to remove the 28
images. Devstack is one of the last projects using this image. Update
its usage to fedora-29 so that we can remove Fedora 28.

Change-Id: Ie70e706083ed1558eb6fc4846e4ac3fab21ecbed

commit_message:
Implement "list_ns_pids" inside Neutron

Instead of using Pyroute2.netns.ns_pids() [1], while [2] is not
solved, a method to list a namespace PIDs is implemented in this
patch.

This implementation is based on the Pyroute2 method.

[1]https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/blob/80f6e7fcdd4136933a7f164ba2cee25f134dc85c/pyroute2/netns/__init__.py#L163
[2]https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/issues/633

Change-Id: Ic00c02035a0dabf1a1efd1995c84692649c6ad27
Related-Bug: #1841753

commit_message:
Implement system reader for OAUTH1 consumers

This change updates the OAUTH1 policies to understand the reader role.
This also adds tests for both the system reader and system member users.

Change-Id: I330d4d3d7373cdafdce207acb1cbab4e774bac65
Partial-bug: #1805363

Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: Ic60993c2315e8b10da8abb1fb02e33151a1e2b98

commit_message:
Implement system admin for implied roles

This change updates the create and delete actions for the implied roles
policies to support the system-specific admin check string. For the time
being, we're deferring adding support for the domain scope type and
domain-specific check strings, but may add it in the future.

Change-Id: I649f8f919fffc751aea750a5228f71cec8c6e184
Partial-bug: #1805371

commit_message:
Drop Python2.7 support

Monasca-analytics builds on Spark and is supporting Python3.6
but the old version of Spark doesn't support Python3.6. So we
drop Python2.7 support with this patch.

Change-Id: Ib58d3a22c71e5237d57a8436e1208922586db091

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Ignore LB not existed when delete member pool

A Cluster can't detach a LB policy was attached before
when i do deleted LB have id is specifying in that LB policy.

Closes-Bug: #1830152
Change-Id: Iedc9b65eef35c0f6a16cb7caa34269a9a63c2a87

commit_message:
Remove BackupDriverWithVerify class

It was introduced more then 5 years ago and no backup drivers
implemented this interface. So it looks safe to just remove it.

Change-Id: Ib10f3b8ff55d72a6abd212175e88c8dddedd3466

Thanks Thomas. Pardon my ignorance - where/how does this show up in the doc build?'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-09-12 12:57:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> Thanks Thomas. Pardon my ignorance - where/how does this show up in
 > the doc build?

It doesn't. It only shows up if you build docs using the manpage builder, which I guess distros would be doing."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-09-12 12:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Actually, can we get a bug so we can backport this?'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-09-12 13:00:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Thanks Thomas. Pardon my ignorance - where/how does this show up
 > in
 > > the doc build?
 > 
 > It doesn't. It only shows up if you build docs using the manpage
 > builder, which I guess distros would be doing.

For clarity, that can be done using:

  $ source .tox/docs/bin/activate
  $ sphinx-build -b man doc/source doc/build/man
  $ deactivate"}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-09-12 13:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-09-12 13:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > 
 > It doesn't. It only shows up if you build docs using the manpage
 > builder, which I guess distros would be doing.

Yes. And you can build manually from the docs venv. I added the command to the commit msg to be more clear."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-09-12 13:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-09-12 13:12:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Add nova-status to man-pages list

nova-status was missing in the list of man-pages. So when building the
man-pages with:

sphinx-build -b man doc/source doc/build/man

there is no "nova-status" in doc/build/man.

Also sort the list alphabetically so it's easier to parse for humans.

Closes-Bug: 1843714
Change-Id: I20b73d508bc6341195c991111ac84c3e35905c92

subject: Change ovs-agent iteration log level to INFO

I like this a lot - but I do think a release note that lets operators know that if they do a lot of port operations and they have provisioned a small /var.  They could have up to seven new log lines for each iteration of process_network_ports()?  Better to err on the side of transparency.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-03-16 03:12:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I like this a lot - but I do think a release note that lets
 > operators know that if they do a lot of port operations and they
 > have provisioned a small /var.  They could have up to seven new log
 > lines for each iteration of process_network_ports()?  Better to err
 > on the side of transparency.

If ovs-agent has nothing to do, this patch only adds two extra info log to indicate the agent is still running the rpc_loop. If there are port processing things need to be done, the  extra logs is about a drop in the bucket. IMO, a release note should be added when it is important or critical to the user, or something related to the real technical matters. We do not expand the log too much, from my test env/results, it is really small log per day:

I had the same opinion, but as Liu commented, if the agent is inactive (no port operations), there will be just a couple of extra lines per RPC loop. And because we are always facing problems in clients with too little information in this agent, I would like to have those messages in INFO level by default.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-03-20 14:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I think this should be discussed in the team. Maybe You can raise it on neutron team meeting or send email to openstack-discuss ML to ask operators about their opinion about that"}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-03-25 10:39:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> I'm not sure if that is good idea. This will cause really a lot if
 > logs logged. Check e.g. log from one tempest job for this patch:
 > http://logs.openstack.org/41/638641/9/check/tempest-full/36f5260/controller/logs/screen-q-agt.txt.gz?level=INFO
 > - it's 5MB of log file only from this short job.

This first iteration log started at "Mar 22 09:35:58.783167", and the log end at "Mar 22 10:52:43.752280". It's about 1hour 17mins and 45 seconds. Estimating the amount of log per day is about 92M. And in these INFO log entries, it is not all ralated to this change. If you run grep "Agent rpc_loop", it is about 2M in these 1hour 17mins and 45 seconds. Then it will be 45M per day.
And if you run a tar for this log, you may see, the final size is in KB level:
-rw-rw-r--.  1 yulong yulong 5.0M Mar 25 06:24 111.txt
-rw-rw-r--.  1 yulong yulong 310K Mar 25 06:30 1.tar.gz
-rw-rw-r--.  1 yulong yulong 2.2M Mar 25 06:25 222.txt
-rw-rw-r--.  1 yulong yulong  85K Mar 25 06:30 2.tar.gz

The LOG is about 2 second with a 612 bytes string:

"""
Mar 22 10:52:43.747567 ubuntu-bionic-rax-ord-0004141955 neutron-openvswitch-agent[4935]: INFO neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent [None req-9d2bf334-fce2-4469-b5c1-19d7e4700706 None None] Agent rpc_loop - iteration:2296 started
Mar 22 10:52:43.752280 ubuntu-bionic-rax-ord-0004141955 neutron-openvswitch-agent[4935]: INFO neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent [None req-9d2bf334-fce2-4469-b5c1-19d7e4700706 None None] Agent rpc_loop - iteration:2296 completed. Processed ports statistics: {'regular': {'updated': 0, 'added': 0, 'removed': 0}}. Elapsed:0.005
"""
Then estimated log size will be 612 * 3600 * 24 / 2 = 26Mb per day. On my OP colleague's experience, they said it is fine about 24M or compressed size 1M per day.

 > I think this should be discussed in the team. Maybe You can raise
 > it on neutron team meeting or send email to openstack-discuss ML to
 > ask operators about their opinion about that

OK, I will raise this to the team meeting.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-03-27 08:48:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: -Code-Review

I'm not really sure if that is needed or not, but I will not -1 on it if others want to merge it :)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-03-28 14:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

It depends on operator choice and we ourselves have no clear consensus on this. One idea is to introduce a config option to control the log level of ovs-agent interaction. 

From my operator experience, it would be nice if these log messages have a same prefix. This makes it easier for operators to grep/exclude them.

At this point, I have no positive/negative opinion on this, so no vote now.'}, {'account_id': 9396, 'date': '2019-04-05 22:04:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

+1 for having the log messages have the same prefix.'}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2019-04-30 22:13:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

For Platform9 Openstack, I've already turned on most of these - the ones where ports are actually processed and plugged in. The only ones we don't print are the start of iteration loop, and the log in loop_count_and_wait. If OVS agent hasn't done any work (no ports updated or added), any need to print these periodic logs?

IMO, at stable state (when nothing is being done), no need to print INFO logs?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-04-30 22:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

Let me put -1 considering feedbacks after my comment.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-05-05 10:15:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

 > ones where ports are actually processed and plugged in. The only

Thanks for the feedback, so, do you mean that you've enable these LOGs locally?

 > loop_count_and_wait. If OVS agent hasn't done any work (no ports
 > updated or added), any need to print these periodic logs?
 > 
 > IMO, at stable state (when nothing is being done), no need to print
 > INFO logs?

If nothing processed, there are only two periodic logs:
2019-05-05 11:21:49.137 88535 INFO neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent [req-8bbc9738-0478-4fdd-a65d-4ff6144bf276 - - - - -] Agent rpc_loop - iteration:214565 started

It is not acceptable?"}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-07-02 16:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-07-02 18:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Change ovs-agent iteration log level to INFO

Operators may want to see how long it takes in the port
processing procedure since DEBUG log does not enable
basically in the production envrionment.

Related-Bug: #1813703
Related-Bug: #1813707
Related-Bug: #1813706
Related-Bug: #1813709

Change-Id: I43733546abf5421d0e3f4cd5a959d279e1b89d1e

commit_message:
Ensure no duplicate IPs are used in undercloud.conf

If duplicate IPs are used in undercloud.conf it will cause
issues with haproxy.

Closes-Bug: #1832168
Change-Id: I35547080aee943438d34b2d62632795af32f8462
(cherry picked from commit 2600260be5ad99da36775e470758591d8fcd2ca9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-12 09:53:36.000000000', 'message': 'healthcheck_port: run ss -ntp with sudo

The output of "ss" is different if you run it as root, or as the user
which is used to execute the process we want to monitor.

e.g. nova-conuductor (check reported bug)

()[root@undercloud /]$ ss -ntp | grep -E ":($ports).*,pid=($pids),"
(empty output)

()[root@undercloud /]$ sudo -u nova ss -ntp | grep -E ":($ports).*,pid=($pids),"
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:56959  192.168.24.3:3306  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=25,fd=7))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:46860  192.168.24.3:3306  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=26,fd=7))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:55918  192.168.24.1:5672  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=26,fd=8))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:56786  192.168.24.1:5672  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=26,fd=9))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:55920  192.168.24.1:5672  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=25,fd=8))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:57238  192.168.24.3:3306  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=25,fd=10))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:56840  192.168.24.1:5672  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=25,fd=9))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:35115  192.168.24.3:3306  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=26,fd=10)

(output was implified for the commit message)

So the idea of this patch is to introduce a new function,
get_user_from_process() which will figure out what user runs the
process, by using pgrep and ps.

More infos about how the ps was done is documented in the code, but to
make it safer we grep the pid AND cmd to get accurate informations.

Then later in healthcheck_port, use the new function to figure out which
user is running the process, then run the "ss" with "sudo -u" to get the
accurate output and know if the process is actually connected to the
port that we want.

Change-Id: I7be514832fc7af8dbcfbafe15b2425db8dcfe3c7
Closes-Bug: #1843555

commit_message:
healthcheck_port: run ss -ntp with sudo

The output of "ss" is different if you run it as root, or as the user
which is used to execute the process we want to monitor.

e.g. nova-conuductor (check reported bug)

()[root@undercloud /]$ ss -ntp | grep -E ":($ports).*,pid=($pids),"
(empty output)

()[root@undercloud /]$ sudo -u nova ss -ntp | grep -E ":($ports).*,pid=($pids),"
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:56959  192.168.24.3:3306  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=25,fd=7))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:46860  192.168.24.3:3306  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=26,fd=7))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:55918  192.168.24.1:5672  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=26,fd=8))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:56786  192.168.24.1:5672  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=26,fd=9))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:55920  192.168.24.1:5672  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=25,fd=8))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:57238  192.168.24.3:3306  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=25,fd=10))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:56840  192.168.24.1:5672  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=25,fd=9))
ESTAB  192.168.24.1:35115  192.168.24.3:3306  users:(("nova-conductor",pid=26,fd=10)

(output was implified for the commit message)

So the idea of this patch is to introduce a new function,
get_user_from_process() which will figure out what user runs the
process, by using pgrep and ps.

More infos about how the ps was done is documented in the code, but to
make it safer we grep the pid AND cmd to get accurate informations.

Then later in healthcheck_port, use the new function to figure out which
user is running the process, then run the "ss" with "sudo -u" to get the
accurate output and know if the process is actually connected to the
port that we want.

Change-Id: I7be514832fc7af8dbcfbafe15b2425db8dcfe3c7
Closes-Bug: #1843555
(cherry picked from commit 32832187434406d766296305e6a4ba7fc8ba9138)

subject: Update Spark version
messages: [{'account_id': 14162, 'date': '2019-09-13 01:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12193, 'date': '2019-09-13 02:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12193, 'date': '2019-09-13 02:23:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-13 01:31:57.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Update Spark version

This patch updates Spark version from 2.1.0 to 2.4.4 for maintenance reason.
And update some packages version depend on Spark.

Change-Id: Idd61243e9e23d99ea8754dc5b313d1583d08878c
'}, {'created': '2019-09-13 02:05:46.000000000', 'message': "Update Spark version

This patch updates Spark version from 2.1.0 to 2.4.4 in order to support Python3.6 or later
because the old version of Spark doesn't support Python3.6. Monasca-analytics builds on
Spark so we will drop Python2.7 support instead of Python3.6 support.
And update some packages version depend on Spark.

Change-Id: Idd61243e9e23d99ea8754dc5b313d1583d08878c
"}]
commit_message:
Update Spark version

This patch updates Spark version from 2.1.0 to 2.4.4 in order to support Python3.6 or later
because the old version of Spark doesn't support Python3.6. Monasca-analytics builds on
Spark so we will drop Python2.7 support instead of Python3.6 support.
And update some packages version depend on Spark.

Change-Id: Idd61243e9e23d99ea8754dc5b313d1583d08878c

commit_message:
Pass Loader to yaml.load to remove YAMLLoadWarning

Pass explicitly Loader to yaml.load so that we can get rid of
YAMLLoadWarning [1].
[1] https://msg.pyyaml.org/load

Also make sure to use context manager when opening file,
so that we don't miss to close it.

Change-Id: Ic12499c3286c6bed5e0ee231ad0c25e01f82b58e

'}, {'created': '2019-08-13 14:16:41.000000000', 'message': "Support reverting migration / resize with bandwidth

When a migration is reverted the source host allocation held by the
migration is swapped back to the instance. If the instance is bandwidth
aware then also the allocation key of the port's binding:profile needs
to be updated to point back to the resource providers of the source host
provider tree. To be able to do that we have to re-calculate the request
group - resource provider mapping for the source host based on the
resource requests in the neutron ports of the instance and the resource
allocation of the instance on the source host. Alternatively we could
store such mapping in the MigrationContext during the move operation.

commit_message:
Support reverting migration / resize with bandwidth

When a migration is reverted the source host allocation held by the
migration is swapped back to the instance. If the instance is bandwidth
aware then also the allocation key of the port's binding:profile needs
to be updated to point back to the resource providers of the source host
provider tree. To be able to do that we have to re-calculate the request
group - resource provider mapping for the source host based on the
resource requests in the neutron ports of the instance and the resource
allocation of the instance on the source host. Alternatively we could
store such mapping in the MigrationContext during the move operation.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: Ib50b6b02208f5bd2972de8a6f8f685c19745514c

commit_message:
Fix waiting OC VMs after restored from snapshot

The libvirt snapshot manipulates with overcloud_nodes, but
waits for the all members of the subnodes group. In general,
those may be unequal. Fix that mismatch.

Change-Id: I92a25daf78f7dfd91cb98618b0ba537ef46828c9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: Rename --backend to --store
messages:
[{'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-05-14 05:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-05-14 11:31:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Change itself looks good, just needs the API changes merged first. Or we could just rename the command line parameter now, release the client and do the API interfacing changes once the API changes lands. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-12 13:46:44.000000000', 'message': "healthcheck_port: run ss with both sudo & root as best effort

Privileged containers are running under the system pid namespace which
makes 'ss' output different from the container user used to run the
process.

e.g. nova-compute is run as nova on the overcloud, but the container is
privileged, so the previous patch with sudo didn't help to fix the
healthcheck. The 'ss' needs to be run as root, not as nova.

In this patch we run the ss twice, once as root, once with sudo, run
sort to make sure we get uniq output; then grep is as before.

Change-Id: Ia2897a6be3e000a9594103502b716431baa615b1
Related-Bug: #1843555
"}, {'created': '2019-09-12 13:47:48.000000000', 'message': "healthcheck_port: run ss with both sudo & root as best effort

Privileged containers are running under the system pid namespace which
makes 'ss' output different from the container user used to run the
process.

e.g. nova-compute is run as nova on the overcloud, but the container is
privileged, so the previous patch with sudo didn't help to fix the
healthcheck. The 'ss' needs to be run as root, not as nova.

In this patch we run the ss twice, once as root, once with sudo, run
sort to make sure we get uniq output; then grep is as before.

Change-Id: Ia2897a6be3e000a9594103502b716431baa615b1
Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1843555
"}]
commit_message:
healthcheck_port: run ss with both sudo & root as best effort

Privileged containers are running under the system pid namespace which
makes 'ss' output different from the container user used to run the
process.

e.g. nova-compute is run as nova on the overcloud, but the container is
privileged, so the previous patch with sudo didn't help to fix the
healthcheck. The 'ss' needs to be run as root, not as nova.

In this patch we run the ss twice, once as root, once with sudo, run
sort to make sure we get uniq output; then grep is as before.

Change-Id: Ia2897a6be3e000a9594103502b716431baa615b1
Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1843555

commit_message:
Add open egress rules to multiple infra charts

This change adds egress rules to the following charts:
- ingress
- memcache
- libvirt
- rabbitmq

These rules will be tightend down in future changes

Change-Id: I6f297d50ca4c06234c7c79986a12cccf3beb5efb

commit_message:
Fix usage of oneOf keyword in schema

Replace 'oneOf' keyword with 'anyOf' when data match more than one subschema.
Replace 'oneof' with 'oneOf' as it is proper keyword.

Change-Id: I0f8258ad102e01051ba0c736442f05bd6e4654d2
Closes-Bug: 1843568

commit_message:
Add manila-status to man-pages list

manila-status was missing in the list of man-pages. So when building the
man-pages with:

    sphinx-build -b man doc/source doc/build/man

there is no "manila-status" in doc/build/man.

Change-Id: Ia2065af8d0ab51a0248d53b3474845ab429803d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-12 18:03:35.000000000', 'message': "Remove required 'groups' for stable/ocata

On stable/ocata, 'groups' of quota APIs are not required property.
So the definition of the required is breaking the stable/ocata gate.
This patch removes it for the branch.

Fixes: #1843762
Change-Id: I3b0cd68a7015f89fb678b715e0967c9690058f76
"}]
commit_message:
Remove required 'groups' for stable/ocata

On stable/ocata, 'groups' of quota APIs are not required property.
So the definition of the required is breaking the stable/ocata gate.
This patch removes it for the branch.

Fixes: #1843762
Change-Id: I3b0cd68a7015f89fb678b715e0967c9690058f76

commit_message:
Additional OVS-DPDK configs including bonding support

Enhance the Neutron charts to support configuration parameters for
following additional configurations for deploying OVS with DPDK:-

1. Bonding support
2. Jumbo Frame support
3. Number of Rx Queue and Rx and Tx Queue sizes

Change-Id: I4ee7c8465825cf7d66d175446c4145a8a26b6381

commit_message:
Fix don't work with senlin actions

We can't do run senlin actions because have an error when
init client senlin. We need an other way to init client to
run client with cron trigger and manual.

Change-Id: I294d18b341a3c7dd0df9c24588540f9c94dd4562
Closes-Bug: #1843178

[{'created': '2019-09-07 21:37:05.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: remove redundant exception log to reduce noise

If RBDVolumeProxy fails to open the underlying image it reraises the
exception, so there is no need to log it unconditionally.  The caller
can gracefully handle this case without alarming the admin.

Change-Id: If5a9d014dbdd63a6e4659d700671c6ac6496b96a
(cherry picked from commit 71584d6852a6dec8d8d04c8f3cbddf0f114777af)
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: remove redundant exception log to reduce noise

If RBDVolumeProxy fails to open the underlying image it reraises the
exception, so there is no need to log it unconditionally.  The caller
can gracefully handle this case without alarming the admin.

Change-Id: If5a9d014dbdd63a6e4659d700671c6ac6496b96a
(cherry picked from commit 71584d6852a6dec8d8d04c8f3cbddf0f114777af)

This adds the ability for us to specifically exclude some patterns of
parameters from the warning that is generated during the deployment for
unused heat params. The params being added are generated by the
deployment and not necessarily provided by the end user. The params
currently being excluded are:

 * '^(Docker|Container).*Image$' - container image vars

commit_message:
Add exclusions to the unused param warning

This adds the ability for us to specifically exclude some patterns of
parameters from the warning that is generated during the deployment for
unused heat params. The params being added are generated by the
deployment and not necessarily provided by the end user. The params
currently being excluded are:

 * '^(Docker|Container).*Image$' - container image vars
 * '^SwiftFetchDir(Get|Put)Tempurl$' - temp url for ceph
 * '^PythonInterpreter$' - python executable for the deploy

The warning message is also slightly adjusted to try and clarify that
the vars might be valid but not used due to service or deployment
configs.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/constants.py
	tripleoclient/workflows/parameters.py

Change-Id: Iad7d97346993b5c95443092b81d056293cdad752
Closes-Bug: #1842754
(cherry picked from commit b25a9a953bfe6923cb855ca22e4f84e620241956)

commit_message:
Convert kernel-baremetal-puppet to ansible

This change deprecates the kernel-baremetal-puppet deployment process
and replaces it with an ansible based deployment using the new
tripleo-kernel role.

Story: 2005998
Task: 34507
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676506/
Change-Id: I30270943aa66a8a982657af3d7d59b8425534b0d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix for clear_foreign_config() unsupported on some controllers

iDRAC driver fails to clear foreign drives on some controllers
and returns  message_id ``STOR058`` which means controllers does
not support clear_foreign_config operation.

Change-Id: I7df2d30242e7a490dfdce04d7f6ce98c68e9f0ed

PDF documentation build

The document is simple enough, so 'howto' is specified as
documentclass instead of 'manual' as most projects do.

commit_message:
Drop deprecated Keystone V2 API support

Keystone V2 API was deprecated in Stein release in Horizon and
removed from Keystone in Queens release.

Change-Id: I917e273d3174adf0874e516b3d635ccb8ba58a27

Add horizon ingress netpol rule

work done in patch set [0].

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-04 06:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-04 06:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-04 06:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-04 06:47:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-04 06:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-04 06:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-04 08:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-05 09:09:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-05 09:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-09-05 10:58:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

I generally think that the approach is incorrect. You're generating certificates and keys for the OVN DBs service but using them from all services connecting to it. While it may work, I think that it is conceptually wrong.
Either we use server side only authentication and we don't need the private keys on the clients, or we use MTLS and generate/deploy separate keys on the clients (ovn-controller & metadata-agent)"}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-05 12:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-05 14:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-08 14:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-08 15:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-09 05:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-09 08:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-09-09 09:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

We'll need to use mutual authentication when using OVN services and TLS. So we'll need to generate certificates for ovn-northd, ovn-controller, ovn-metadata-agent and neutron-server. Perhaps we can generate one single certificate/key for all the OVN-clients...


 219  ovs-pki init --force
  221  ls  /var/lib/openvswitch/pki/switchca/cacert.pem
  225  cp /usr/local/var/lib/openvswitch/pki/switchca/cacert.pem /etc/openvswitch/
  227  ovs-pki req ovnnb
  228  ovs-pki -b sign ovnnb
  229  ovs-pki --help|grep -i verify
  230  ovs-pki verify ovnnb
  237  ovs-pki req ovnsb
  238  ovs-pki -b sign ovnsb
  266  ovs-pki req ovncontroller
  267  ovs-pki -b sign ovncontroller switch

$ ps -aef|grep ovsdb-server-sb
vagrant  24736 24735  0 03:11 ?        00:00:00 ovsdb-server -vconsole:off -vfile:info --log-file=/opt/stack/logs/ovsdb-server-sb.log --remote=punix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnsb_db.sock --pidfile=/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnsb_db.pid --unixctl=ovnsb_db.ctl --detach --monitor --remote=db:OVN_Southbound,SB_Global,connections --private-key=db:OVN_Southbound,SSL,private_key --certificate=db:OVN_Southbound,SSL,certificate --ca-cert=db:OVN_Southbound,SSL,ca_cert --ssl-protocols=db:OVN_Southbound,SSL,ssl_protocols --ssl-ciphers=db:OVN_Southbound,SSL,ssl_ciphers /opt/data/ovs/ovnsb_db.db


root     24190     1  0 03:09 ?        00:00:00 ovn-controller unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/db.sock -vconsole:emer -vsyslog:err -vfile:info --no-chdir --log-file=/opt/stack/logs/ovn-controller.log --pidfile=/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovn-controller.pid -C /etc/openvswitch/cacert.pem -p /etc/openvswitch/ovncontroller-privkey.pem -c /etc/openvswitch/ovncontroller-cert.pem --detach


ovn-controller logs:

2018-10-09T03:15:56.037Z|00007|reconnect|INFO|ssl:127.0.0.1:6642: connected
2018-10-09T03:15:56.041Z|00008|ofctrl|INFO|unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/br-int.mgmt: connecting to switch
2018-10-09T03:15:56.041Z|00009|rconn|INFO|unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/br-int.mgmt: connecting...
2018-10-09T03:15:56.041Z|00010|rconn|INFO|unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/br-int.mgmt: connected
2018-10-09T03:15:56.042Z|00001|pinctrl(ovn_pinctrl0)|INFO|unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/br-int.mgmt: connecting to switch
2018-10-09T03:15:56.042Z|00002|rconn(ovn_pinctrl0)|INFO|unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/br-int.mgmt: connecting...
2018-10-09T03:15:56.042Z|00003|rconn(ovn_pinctrl0)|INFO|unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/br-int.mgmt: connected


If I start ovn-controller without cert/key, I get this error:

2018-10-09T03:18:46.851Z|00025|stream_ssl|ERR|Private key must be configured to use SSL
2018-10-09T03:18:46.851Z|00026|stream_ssl|ERR|Certificate must be configured to use SSL'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-09 09:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-09-09 09:52:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

I forgot a couple of commands:

  235  ovn-nbctl set-ssl /etc/openvswitch/ovnnb-privkey.pem     /etc/openvswitch/ovnnb-cert.pem  /etc/openvswitch/cacert.pem
  236  ovn-nbctl set-connection pssl:6641
  239  ovn-sbctl set-ssl /etc/openvswitch/ovnsb-privkey.pem     /etc/openvswitch/ovnsb-cert.pem  /etc/openvswitch/cacert.pem
  240  ovn-sbctl set-connection pssl:6642

Also, another approach could be to generate OVN certificates 'per chassis' as the OVN sandbox does:
https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/blob/master/tutorial/ovs-sandbox#L406

In each chassis we will tell ovn-controller to use its own cert/key and metadata-agent can use it as well. WDYT?"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-09-09 09:57:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

We'll need security team inputs here as if we can generate the keys on every compute node it seems to me much more secure than generate a single key somewhere and deploy it all over the place. But I don't know how it's currently being done for other services."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-09-09 14:04:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-09-09 15:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1

which CI job covers this change?'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-09 16:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Workflow-1

Unfortunatly tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001, so -1 for workflow I need to correct tht and probably change dependency'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-09 16:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

And thank you for review all!'}, {'account_id': 14250, 'date': '2019-09-10 08:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Yes, each service should use it's own keys. Since they run in different containers, they should only have access (volume mounts) to the specific certs/keys they use, + a common mount to the CA. 

Certmonger is a service which runs on every host enrolled to IPA on a "TLS Everywhere" deployment. It generates certificates on each host and sends them to the central IPA service to co-sign. They are then mounted into containers in a later step.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-10 10:20:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-09-11 16:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-09-12 13:34:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-09-12 15:32:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Support connecting OVN DB over SSL

This patch introduce parameters which support using SSL to connect to
OVN_Northbound DB and OVN_Southbound DB.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674603/
Change-Id: I03bda5d2e36ab168079fc7e8be220c9a4e29e44f
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>

Do we want to add a release note to this to make sure there is something informing users to add these config options to the other conf files? Or will we include that in later notes?'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-01-15 11:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-13 05:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-06-13 05:58:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-08-05 13:06:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I agree with Sean that this needs a release note.  I'd suggest something like this:

---
features:
  - |
    The glance-scrubber utility is now multistore aware.  If you
    are using the multistore feature, you must define configuration
    options for ``os_glance_tasks_store`` and ``os_glance_staging_store``
    in the ``glance-scrubber.conf`` file.  See the "Reserved Stores"
    section of the "Multi Store Support" chapter of the Glance
    Administration Guide for more information.

upgrade:
  - |
    If you are using the multistore feature, you must define
    configuration options for ``os_glance_tasks_store`` and
    ``os_glance_staging_store`` in the ``glance-scrubber.conf`` file.
    See the "Reserved Stores" section of the "Multi Store Support"
    chapter of the Glance Administration Guide for more information.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-08-06 08:34:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-08-06 08:35:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Brian,

Thank you, added release notes as per your suggestion!!!'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-08-06 08:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-08-06 16:35:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Looks good.  Please take a look at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674697/ particularly the change to etc/oslo-config-generator/glance-scrubber.conf to make sure the multstore config is being added correctly.'}, {'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2019-08-13 15:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-12 16:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Simple enough change, and everything looks good to me.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-25 05:31:17.000000000', 'message': 'Multiple backned support for scrubber and cache-prefetcher

In Rocky multiple backend support is added as an experimental API
feature. As of now multiple backend works with glance-api but it
is missing in glance-scrubber and glance-cache-prefetcher.

Made provision to initialize multiple backend related config options
in scrubber and cache-prefetcher utilities.

NOTE:
Operator needs to define multiple backends related config options in
glance-scrubber.conf and glance-cache.conf as well.

Change-Id: I7327ff5db8fa19e6813a0fe0fb657eab19f8b61f
Closes-Bug: #1794225

commit_message:
Multiple backend support for scrubber

In Rocky multiple backend support is added as an experimental API
feature. As of now multiple backend works with glance-api but it
is missing in glance-scrubber.

Made provision to initialize multiple backend related config options
in scrubber.

NOTE:
Operator needs to define multiple backends related config options in
glance-scrubber.conf.

Change-Id: I7327ff5db8fa19e6813a0fe0fb657eab19f8b61f
Closes-Bug: #1794225

commit_message:
Use python3 source installs of OpenStack services where possible

Detect CentOS and deploy from source as python2, otherwise default to
python3 on all other distros.

Change-Id: Ic68dc0923a26ece68b1971648c62bb2e0c05c50b

[{'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2019-06-10 08:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-06-10 08:30:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

from the undercloud.conf file

commit_message:
Ensure no duplicate IPs are used in undercloud.conf

If duplicate IPs are used in undercloud.conf it will cause
issues with haproxy.

Closes-Bug: #1832168
Change-Id: I35547080aee943438d34b2d62632795af32f8462

Adding member to image will first retrieve the image using get call. commit_message:
Adding member to image fails for multiple stores

If multiple stores is enabled then adding member to image fails with
UnknownScheme: Unknown scheme 'XXXX' found in URI while setting _acls
to the store.

Made provision to call 'set_acls_for_multi_store' if multiple stores
are enabled.

Change-Id: I7594185396f7a58a3c0aeeacab891b5eb18a8bf3
Closes-Bug: #1838332

commit_message:
Add reserved stores to the sample config file

Since we know the names of the reserved stores, we can add them
to the config file to make it easier for operators to configure
these things.

Includes deprecation of the 'work_dir' and 'node_staging_uri'
options.

Change-Id: I992cf468f9ce156ba51b1dd025459939acd8dce0

commit_message:
add cyborg-tempest job and remove cyborg-devstack job

this patch:
1. added cyborg-tempest[0] job to cyborg
2. removed cyborg-devstack job since cyborg-tempest job already contains
devstack_plugins
3. deleted legacy/cyborg-devstack/** for two reasons:
  1) cyborg-devstack is removed
  2) in zuul v3, devstack base job changed to the following[1][2]

[0]https://github.com/openstack/cyborg-tempest-plugin/blob/master/.zuul.yaml#L12
[1]https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#reworking-legacy-jobs-to-be-v3-native
[2]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/500365/34

Change-Id: Ia25b0e83f8438c57e698fe0fc781ff6fc5d77164

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 08:02:50.000000000', 'message': 'MultiStore: Lazy update fails if image is not owned by owner

Lazy updating store information in location metadata fails if image
is not owned by the user. The reason is saving this information to
image object returns Forbidden error as the user is not allowed to change
the image information. Actually after updating the location information
there is no need to explicitly call save function because when location
information is updated using image.locations object it is updated to
database at the same time.

To fix this issue, remved the image_repo.save call, so that Lazy update
should be allowed to index as well as show call for all the users.

Change-Id: I92c85647ea4eea7069f8124334402f9127bf653c
Closes-Bug: #1840885
'}]
commit_message:
MultiStore: Lazy update fails if image is not owned by owner

Lazy updating store information in location metadata fails if image
is not owned by the user. The reason is saving this information to
image object returns Forbidden error as the user is not allowed to change
the image information. Actually after updating the location information
there is no need to explicitly call save function because when location
information is updated using image.locations object it is updated to
database at the same time.

To fix this issue, remved the image_repo.save call, so that Lazy update
should be allowed to index as well as show call for all the users.

Change-Id: I92c85647ea4eea7069f8124334402f9127bf653c
Closes-Bug: #1840885

commit_message:
Only log zone not found when notifing

We are currently logging zone not found when
quering the SOA record. This should only
happen when notifing.

Change-Id: Iad790593a809a165718d3700cf7325f52208dab1
Closes-Bug: #1671636

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie360bf532f746eae645aebd4ddea578bd24880b1

commit_message:
Add man pages to packages for different services

Also:
- barbican: Add doc subpackage
- manila: Make doc build optional (but on by default)
- nova: Move man-pages to the different subpackages
- ironic: Make doc build optional (but on by default)
- keystone: Make doc build optional (but on by default)

Change-Id: I882bfc2667af08bd080dccc805589367f00dd06e

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibc91a8774a37d85020758df54d9b53d952a26c9a

commit_message:
Migrate from Amulet to Zaza

This patch migrate tests from Amulet to Zaza, and Python3 only.

SSL is enabled for all bundles with charm-vault, except trusty, which is
not supported by vault.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/55

Partial-Bug: 1828424

Change-Id: I4dacf33d3ab4dedbbe62a36b1b2ce5606e51d234
Signed-off-by: Joe Guo <guoqiao@gmail.com>

@Radomir, would like to try the changes, do you know how to make the password expired?'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-08-26 08:24:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

You don't need to have the password expired to test the view  you can simply visit /auth/password/[user uuid]/  the handling of expired passwords is added in the next patch, and there to test:
1. change keystone.conf to set change_password_upon_first_use = true
2. as an admin, change the password of your test user
3. try to log in as that test user
You should be redirected to a password change page."}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2019-08-26 22:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks Radomir for the information: 

I did the followings:
pulled down you changes
updated /etc/keystone/keystone.conf and added

commit_message:
Add a view for changing user password while not logged in

Keystone's API for changing the user password doesn't require
authentication, so we can have a page that doesn't require it too.
In order to change the password, the user has to provide their old
password. This is needed for when the password is expired or when
it has to be changed on first use.

The next step will be adding a redirect to this page when a password
is expired or required to be changed.

Part of blueprint: allow-users-change-expired-password
Change-Id: I3b207ef6c5a3095022a2acb64d3988e127f0f49a

[{'account_id': 30113, 'date': '2019-04-18 15:31:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-04-18 15:31:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-04-19 06:43:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

 > clarified before move this forward.

I have added more detail in the blueprint.

Substantially, my organization runs an OpenStack and a Kubernetes deployment. Users can have resources assigned on both deployments. To authenticate to Kubernetes users must employ OpenStack application credentials. To enhance usability we have added a button in Horizon which allows the download of a pre-compiled Kubernetes configuration file with the application credential parameters already embedded. Users just need to download and copy this file as ~/.kubeconfig to start using kubectl right away.

We wanted to share this patch with the rest of the community."}, {'account_id': 30113, 'date': '2019-05-23 19:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Downloadable Kubernetes configuration file

Kubernetes can use OpenStack application credentials for authentication.
Generate a kubeconfig file and make it available to download along with the
openrc and clouds.yaml files.

blueprint kubernetes-config-gen

Change-Id: I298370e7abf4f0d480bd5199060f24bab6d6daaa

commit_message:
Bump openstackdocstheme to 1.20.0

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: I048b67105b3b76ac3c8c89cd052bd018fbc3ca87

* Hedvig-CI http://os-logserver.hedviginc.com/refs/changes/88/616088/1 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2018-11-07 09:53:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Leave a comment with 'run-dell-emc-sc' to trigger a recheck, for more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/Dell_EMC_SC_Series_CI"}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-11-08 10:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 24496, 'date': '2018-11-09 14:48:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Build failed. To recheck use 'datacore: recheck'. For information about DataCore CI see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DataCore_CI

- dsvm-tempest-datacore-iscsi-driver http://173.221.96.158/88/616088/1/check/dsvm-tempest-datacore-iscsi-driver/90fdbd2 : FAILURE in 47m 40s
- dsvm-tempest-datacore-fc-driver http://173.221.96.158/88/616088/1/check/dsvm-tempest-datacore-fc-driver/751a7e6 : RETRY_LIMIT"}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2018-11-10 00:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looks good to me. However, I wonder why we should add this to the gate if we already have a `[testenv:cover]` inside `tox.ini`?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-26 18:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Having [testenv:cover] in tox.ini allows someone to run "tox -e cover" to get the test coverage output. This adds a job to be run by zuul that does exactly that.

That said, we have always just had this as something someone could run locally to get that data. I'm not sure if we need it run on every patch. Cinder already has a large number of jobs that need to run for every patch, so this adds extra overhead that (IMO at least) will probably just get ignored the majority of the time. I'm not convinced we should add it as zuul job.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-11-27 20:19:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I don't think it makes sense to add this as a gate job.  It just means another unit test run without much benefit.

Maybe we should consider combining coverage output with one of the existing unit test jobs if think anyone will look the results when reviewing patches."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-09-12 17:46:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

(7 comments)

Thanks for your patch.  I think this change looks good.  However, this patch changes external specification.  So, could you add releasenote for this patch?  In addition, please make sure following points:

* Which file to define?
* Which section[1] to use?

[1] e.g. [default_firewall_group_rules] or [default_fwg_rules] ..'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2019-02-06 20:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2019-02-06 20:42:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2019-02-06 21:05:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2019-02-08 02:30:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I'm sorry for late reply.  Yeah, logic looks good.  So, please fix some nits.  In addition, could you tell me the result /etc/neutron/neutron_fwaas.conf after deploying devstack ??  Is there any example configuration about default_fwg_rules?"}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2019-02-08 02:36:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2019-02-11 18:10:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2019-02-20 04:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2019-07-29 14:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2019-07-29 15:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2019-07-30 00:18:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

(4 comments)

Sorry I was late reply.  Now FWaaS v2 is 'firewall group'.  So, I think it's better to align with 'firewall groupl'.  Could you fix them?"}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2019-07-31 09:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 20363, 'date': '2019-08-06 11:00:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

I think a fuller & better solution will be to define a set of default rules in the config. not necessary only 4 (ingress/egress ipv4/6)., but what the user really needs.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2019-08-09 09:36:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > I think a fuller & better solution will be to define a set of
 > default rules in the config. not necessary only 4 (ingress/egress

It is only default firewall group rules, you want to have it as minimalistic as it can be. revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 07:38:52.000000000', 'message': 'Default firewall rules from configuration file

Add new options to configuration file for using in Default firewall
rules. Separate ingress and egress: action, source ipv4, source ipv6,
source port, destination ipv4, destination ipv6, destination port.
Shared options for ingress and egress: protocol, enabled and shared.

New options are used in _create_default_firewall_rules and default
value are same as before this change, ingress (deny all),
egress (allow all).

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1799358

Change-Id: Ic48872f3b7dfd4a87065799b7d3656de3d06e4c3
Closes-Bug: 1799358

commit_message:
Default firewall group rules from configuration file

Add new options to neutron_fwaas.conf for using in Default firewall group
rules. Separate ingress and egress: action, source ipv4, source ipv6,
source port, destination ipv4, destination ipv6, destination port.
Shared options for ingress and egress: protocol, enabled and shared.

New options are used in _create_default_firewall_rules and default
value are same as before this change, ingress (deny all),
egress (allow all).

Change-Id: Ic48872f3b7dfd4a87065799b7d3656de3d06e4c3
Closes-Bug: #1799358

commit_message:
Fix default security group in samples/local.sh

The script currently complains about multiple default security groups. This
obtains the default and uses it when creating security group rules.

Change-Id: I81e59eae5df79889ed1fb02d45af26e3a55aa0e9

commit_message:
Use cloudkitty.tzutils.diff_seconds() in prometheus collector

This replaces a manual datetime substraction in the prometheus collector
with the diff_seconds() function.

Change-Id: I914ea762a346f4d8f6ac71aa3c56b838eb5bf30b

commit_message:
Neutron: Enable Rolling Update

Enable rolloing update for dhcp_agent and l3_agent. It is already
enabled for other agents.

Change-Id: Iab78744d5afc24a56045bd5cd7e0c2b36c330a9e

commit_message:
Move default values defined in settings.py to defaults.py

Some remaining default values of openstack_dashboard are still defined
in settings.py. This commit moves them to openstack_dashboard/defaults.py.
If the default values are same as those defined in horizon,
they are just dropped.

Part of blueprint ini-based-configuration
Change-Id: I723a8f9064450972d4510ac9e8b423f3041d1cac

TIME_ZONE=UTC. Previously TIME_ZONE was not set in horizon.test.settings
and the default value America/Chicago was used. Horizon uses UTC as the
default value of TIME_ZONE, so it is better to use UTC for testing too.

commit_message:
Define default settings explicitly (horizon)

test_parse_isotime_filter in test_filters is updated to match
TIME_ZONE=UTC. Previously TIME_ZONE was not set in horizon.test.settings
and the default value America/Chicago was used. Horizon uses UTC as the
default value of TIME_ZONE, so it is better to use UTC for testing too.

horizon settings in openstack_dashboard.settings are moved to
under horizon.

Part of blueprint ini-based-configuration
Change-Id: I9abdbbe0dcefc08ffea61143e3c0a87ed87b2e2a

commit_message:
PowerMax driver - check cylinder count of source and target volumes

Check the cylinder count of the source and target volumes when creating
a  clone.  If the source is larger than the target then an exception should
be raised and a target cleanup performed.  Fix to target cleanup code
also

Change-Id: I96796c69233ce13f9817f21f975725dbc794d097

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-17 10:17:23.000000000', 'message': 'PowerMax Driver - SnapVX NoCopy Mode

The PowerMax for Cinder driver now implements noCopy mode
for links between SnapVX source and target.  This change
will improve space efficiency by using pointers instead of
copied tracks when source and target volumes are linked.

Change-Id: Idfc8de789a27f54d9211be3c1ea6778586f85672
'}, {'created': '2019-07-18 10:16:47.000000000', 'message': 'PowerMax Driver - SnapVX NoCopy Mode

will improve space efficiency by using pointers instead of
copied tracks when source and target volumes are linked.

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - SnapVX NoCopy Mode

The PowerMax for Cinder driver now implements noCopy mode
for links between SnapVX source and target.  This change
will improve space efficiency by using pointers instead of
copied tracks when source and target volumes are linked.

Change-Id: Idfc8de789a27f54d9211be3c1ea6778586f85672

commit_message:
Blacklist eventlet 0.23.0, 0.25.0

Kombu 4.6.4 causes issues with eventlet 0.23.0 and 0.25.0[1].
Due to an upper-constraint version bump, we're seeing failures
on openstack gate.
This patch fixes the issue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678078

Change-Id: I7e89a9710b6be8b58872d4f44168fcf92b15f711

commit_message:
Move openstack_dashboard specific settings from horizon

Cookie-based settings related to openstack_dashboard are located
under horizon directory,, but they are not related to "horizon".
This commit moves them to "openstack_dashboard" directory.

Part of blueprint ini-based-configuration
Change-Id: Id48ececdbe819a95485e9a91dc5a1a163a5568c3

[{'created': '2019-09-03 20:41:13.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid forced logout when 403 error encountered

Before this change when a 403 error was encountered, such as failure to
have the permission to perform an operation, the user would get logged
out from UI pages written in the AngularJS framework. For example, if an
admin user lacks the get_project permission and tries to access the
images page, project->compute->images, the 403 will forcibly log out
the user.

This change keeps the user logged in when a 403 error is encountered and
displays an error message. The change only affects AngularJS pages.

Change-Id: I10a6eeb96dd1418449e1d15b1a3869cd4de9cafa
Closes-bug: #1840844
(cherry picked from commit ab0e96df9506fb6f1783e0ee79b63934dabe0cbe)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid forced logout when 403 error encountered

Before this change when a 403 error was encountered, such as failure to
have the permission to perform an operation, the user would get logged
out from UI pages written in the AngularJS framework. For example, if an
admin user lacks the get_project permission and tries to access the
images page, project->compute->images, the 403 will forcibly log out
the user.

This change keeps the user logged in when a 403 error is encountered and
displays an error message. The change only affects AngularJS pages.

Change-Id: I10a6eeb96dd1418449e1d15b1a3869cd4de9cafa
Closes-bug: #1840844
(cherry picked from commit ab0e96df9506fb6f1783e0ee79b63934dabe0cbe)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-26 14:56:08.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize query for host allocations API call

The host allocations query can take a very long time on just a few
hundred nodes. This occurs because the ORM call in the
get_reservation_allocation_by_host_ids function is not optimized. The
slow down appears to come from a combination of a three-table join,
retrieving all columns, and only a few filters. This patch significantly
speeds up the call by breaking the query into two, selecting only
necessary columns and filtering for only active and pending allocations.

Additionally, this patch makes some modifications to what is returned
by the Allocations API. The biggest advantage of the Allocations API
is the ability for admins and users to see usage and availability of
resources. However, due to RBAC for lease list functionality, it is not
possibility users to use allocations API for this purpose. This adds
start_date and end_date for users so that they can use allocations api
to see usage and availability of resources. This will also make the
allocations API more conducive to being implemented in blazar-dashboard
so that the plugin does not need to hit the blazar db directly.

Change-Id: I0fb4c8ea436c759fca1365cb1955c5225a54fd4d
Closes-Bug: #1838025
'}, {'created': '2019-08-02 16:28:15.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize query for host allocations API call

The host allocations query can take a very long time on just a few
hundred nodes. This occurs because the ORM call in the
get_reservation_allocation_by_host_ids function is not optimized. The
slow down appears to come from a combination of a three-table join,
retrieving all columns, and only a few filters. This patch significantly
speeds up the call by breaking the query into two, selecting only
necessary columns and filtering for only active and pending allocations.

Change-Id: I0fb4c8ea436c759fca1365cb1955c5225a54fd4d
Closes-Bug: #1838025
'}, {'created': '2019-08-02 17:34:29.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize query for host allocations API call

The host allocations query can take a very long time on just a few
hundred nodes. This occurs because the ORM call in the
get_reservation_allocation_by_host_ids function is not optimized. The
slow down appears to come from a combination of a three-table join,
retrieving all columns, and only a few filters. This patch significantly
speeds up the call by breaking the query into two, selecting only

Change-Id: I0fb4c8ea436c759fca1365cb1955c5225a54fd4d
Closes-Bug: #1838025
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize query for host allocations API call

The host allocations query can take a very long time on just a few
hundred nodes. This occurs because the ORM call in the
get_reservation_allocation_by_host_ids function is not optimized. The
slow down appears to come from a combination of a three-table join,
retrieving all columns, and only a few filters. This patch significantly
speeds up the call by breaking the query into two, selecting only
necessary columns and filtering for only active and pending allocations.

Change-Id: I0fb4c8ea436c759fca1365cb1955c5225a54fd4d
Closes-Bug: #1838025

commit_message:
Remove sheepdog tests from zuul config

The sheepdog project is no longer maintained [0], so this removes the
test configuration as part of an effort to clean up those test
definitions. The glance_store support for sheepdog should also be
deprecated and removed, but that will be done separately.

[0] http://lists.wpkg.org/pipermail/sheepdog/2019-March/068451.html

Change-Id: I79d9dbc8f6ebea381d99e96c4ba4194ba0188b8a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a7a6064e7dc4775d08753f029c2589a4586e0f66)
(cherry picked from commit 27e421af26cd1bcc68746a0beadb541fb8d647be)

commit_message:
Pylint: use -j 0 arg

"-j 0" runs on the number of CPUs available, just
pass that instead of counting CPUs ourselves.

(This removes a stealthy python2 dependency, too.)

Change-Id: Ia058036ce8bd22be3b93a6fb71c66cb1b5e5f394

commit_message:
Continue renaming of volume_utils (drivers)

Now that volume_utils has been renamed, import it
and use it consistently everywhere.

Change-Id: Ib21c731c480889a8e2040d142d86b593c6ce991c

commit_message:
Use tzutils functions in gnocchi collector

Work items:

* Introduce a "substract_delta()" function in "cloudkitty.tzutils". It is
  the opposite of the "add_delta()" function.

* Use tzutils functions to add/substract a timedelta in the gnocchi
  collector instead of directly doing the calculation.

* Add test cases for the new "substract_delta()" function

Change-Id: Ic54d443b18b67e96a5de4cfb46a90f7393196376

nice progress. so you want to add some unit tests like in spec/unit/puppet/provider/pcmk_common_spec.rb
and you should add two tests:

This commit extends the deep_compare loging to stonith resource,
allowing operators to update their cluster configuration by editing
the relevant yaml files and running a stack update.

Tested as following:

1. Deployed overcloud with fencing.yaml containing:

parameter_defaults:
  EnableFencing: true
  FencingConfig:
    devices:
    - agent: fence_ipmilan
      host_mac: 52:54:00:99:08:46
      params:
        ipaddr: 172.16.0.1
        ipport: '6230'
        lanplus: true
        login: admin
        passwd: password

resulting in:

passwd=password

2. Changed the "password" value:

        passwd: bogus

3. Did a stack update, result:

passwd=bogus

commit_message:
Extend deep_compare to stonith resources

This commit extends the deep_compare logic to stonith resources,
allowing operators to update their fencing configuration by editing
the relevant yaml files and running a stack update.

Needs 'pacemaker::stonith::$(fence_XXX)::deep_compare: true' to be set
as it is false by default.

If necessary users can also change the value of:

'pacemaker::stonith::$(fence_XXX)::update_settle_secs' (600s by default)

Tested as following:

1. Deployed overcloud with fencing.yaml containing:

parameter_defaults:
  EnableFencing: true
  FencingConfig:
    devices:
    - agent: fence_ipmilan
      host_mac: 52:54:00:99:08:46
      params:
        ipaddr: 172.16.0.1
        ipport: '6230'
        lanplus: true
        login: admin
        passwd: password

resulting in:

$ pcs stonith show stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400990846 |grep passwd |awk '{print $6}'
passwd=password

2. Changed the "password" value:

        passwd: bogus

3. Did a stack update, result:

$ pcs stonith show stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400990846 |grep passwd |awk '{print $6}'
passwd=bogus

Change-Id: I1a9b3090e84c32755b5d538f0a7ee080221420fe

commit_message:
Use memcached for token caching in ironic authtoken

Use memcached to cache token in ironic authtoken, as in-process
cache, which we currently use, was already deprecated[1].
Also, add unit tests for ironic related manifests.

[1] Ied2b88c8cefe5655a88d0c2f334de04e588fa75a

Change-Id: I0f0ce58682789c8fd8b8625aaebfe4b75aea6105

commit_message:
Replace eventlet with futurist

This replaces the "eventlet" library with "futurist". Futurist does not
require monkey-patching of the standard library, is an openstack project
and is simply an overlay to the python STL in python3, rather than a
partial replacement.

Change-Id: Ib4f3a59377144e1d37028dfc3df77180d79e0c46
